1194 void
1195 TcpSocketBase::ForwardIcmp (Ipv4Address icmpSource, uint8_t icmpTtl,
1196  uint8_t icmpType, uint8_t icmpCode,
1197  uint32_t icmpInfo)
1198 {
1199  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << icmpSource << static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpTtl) <<
1200  static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpType) <<
1201  static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpCode) << icmpInfo);
1202  if (!m_icmpCallback.IsNull ())
1203  {
1204  m_icmpCallback (icmpSource, icmpTtl, icmpType, icmpCode, icmpInfo);
1205  }
1206 }
1207 
1208 void
1209 TcpSocketBase::ForwardIcmp6 (Ipv6Address icmpSource, uint8_t icmpTtl,
1210  uint8_t icmpType, uint8_t icmpCode,
1211  uint32_t icmpInfo)
1212 {
1213  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << icmpSource << static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpTtl) <<
1214  static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpType) <<
1215  static_cast<uint32_t> (icmpCode) << icmpInfo);
1216  if (!m_icmpCallback6.IsNull ())
1217  {
1218  m_icmpCallback6 (icmpSource, icmpTtl, icmpType, icmpCode, icmpInfo);
1219  }
1220 }
1221 
1222 bool
1223 TcpSocketBase::IsValidTcpSegment (const SequenceNumber32 seq, const uint32_t tcpHeaderSize,
1224  const uint32_t tcpPayloadSize)
1225 {
1226  if (tcpHeaderSize == 0 || tcpHeaderSize > 60)
1227  {
1228  NS_LOG_ERROR ("Bytes removed: " << tcpHeaderSize << " invalid");
1229  return false; // Discard invalid packet
1230  }
1231  else if (tcpPayloadSize > 0 && OutOfRange (seq, seq + tcpPayloadSize))
1232  {
1233  // Discard fully out of range data packets
1234  NS_LOG_WARN ("At state " << TcpStateName[m_state] <<
1235  " received packet of seq [" << seq <<
1236  ":" << seq + tcpPayloadSize <<
1237  ") out of range [" << m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence () << ":" <<
1238  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxRxSequence () << ")");
1239  // Acknowledgement should be sent for all unacceptable packets (RFC793, p.69)
1240  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
1241  return false;
1242  }
1243  return true;
1244 }
1245 
1246 void
1247 TcpSocketBase::DoForwardUp (Ptr<Packet> packet, const Address &fromAddress,
1248  const Address &toAddress)
1249 {
1250  // in case the packet still has a priority tag attached, remove it
1251  SocketPriorityTag priorityTag;
1252  packet->RemovePacketTag (priorityTag);
1253 
1254  // Peel off TCP header
1255  TcpHeader tcpHeader;
1256  packet->RemoveHeader (tcpHeader);
1257  SequenceNumber32 seq = tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber ();
1258 
1259  if (m_state == ESTABLISHED && !(tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::RST))
1260  {
1261  // Check if the sender has responded to ECN echo by reducing the Congestion Window
1262  if (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::CWR )
1263  {
1264  // Check if a packet with CE bit set is received. If there is no CE bit set, then change the state to ECN_IDLE to
1265  // stop sending ECN Echo messages. If there is CE bit set, the packet should continue sending ECN Echo messages
1266  //
1267  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD)
1268  {
1269  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_IDLE");
1270  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
1271  }
1272  }
1273  }
1274 
1275  m_rxTrace (packet, tcpHeader, this);
1276 
1277  if (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::SYN)
1278  {
1279  /* The window field in a segment where the SYN bit is set (i.e., a <SYN>
1280  * or <SYN,ACK>) MUST NOT be scaled (from RFC 7323 page 9). But should be
1281  * saved anyway..
1282  */
1283  m_rWnd = tcpHeader.GetWindowSize ();
1284 
1285  if (tcpHeader.HasOption (TcpOption::WINSCALE) && m_winScalingEnabled)
1286  {
1287  ProcessOptionWScale (tcpHeader.GetOption (TcpOption::WINSCALE));
1288  }
1289  else
1290  {
1291  m_winScalingEnabled = false;
1292  }
1293 
1294  if (tcpHeader.HasOption (TcpOption::SACKPERMITTED) && m_sackEnabled)
1295  {
1296  ProcessOptionSackPermitted (tcpHeader.GetOption (TcpOption::SACKPERMITTED));
1297  }
1298  else
1299  {
1300  m_sackEnabled = false;
1301  }
1302 
1303  // When receiving a <SYN> or <SYN-ACK> we should adapt TS to the other end
1304  if (tcpHeader.HasOption (TcpOption::TS) && m_timestampEnabled)
1305  {
1306  ProcessOptionTimestamp (tcpHeader.GetOption (TcpOption::TS),
1307  tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber ());
1308  }
1309  else
1310  {
1311  m_timestampEnabled = false;
1312  }
1313 
1314  // Initialize cWnd and ssThresh
1315  m_tcb->m_cWnd = GetInitialCwnd () * GetSegSize ();
1316  m_tcb->m_cWndInfl = m_tcb->m_cWnd;
1317  m_tcb->m_ssThresh = GetInitialSSThresh ();
1318 
1319  if (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::ACK)
1320  {
1321  EstimateRtt (tcpHeader);
1322  m_highRxAckMark = tcpHeader.GetAckNumber ();
1323  }
1324  }
1325  else if (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::ACK)
1326  {
1327  NS_ASSERT (!(tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::SYN));
1328  if (m_timestampEnabled)
1329  {
1330  if (!tcpHeader.HasOption (TcpOption::TS))
1331  {
1332  // Ignoring segment without TS, RFC 7323
1333  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("At state " << TcpStateName[m_state] <<
1334  " received packet of seq [" << seq <<
1335  ":" << seq + packet->GetSize () <<
1336  ") without TS option. Silently discard it");
1337  return;
1338  }
1339  else
1340  {
1341  ProcessOptionTimestamp (tcpHeader.GetOption (TcpOption::TS),
1342  tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber ());
1343  }
1344  }
1345 
1346  EstimateRtt (tcpHeader);
1347  UpdateWindowSize (tcpHeader);
1348  }
1349 
1350 
1351  if (m_rWnd.Get () == 0 && m_persistEvent.IsExpired ())
1352  { // Zero window: Enter persist state to send 1 byte to probe
1353  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Enter zerowindow persist state");
1354  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Cancelled ReTxTimeout event which was set to expire at " <<
1355  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_retxEvent)).GetSeconds ());
1356  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
1357  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Schedule persist timeout at time " <<
1358  Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds () << " to expire at time " <<
1359  (Simulator::Now () + m_persistTimeout).GetSeconds ());
1360  m_persistEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_persistTimeout, &TcpSocketBase::PersistTimeout, this);
1361  NS_ASSERT (m_persistTimeout == Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_persistEvent));
1362  }
1363 
1364  // TCP state machine code in different process functions
1365  // C.f.: tcp_rcv_state_process() in tcp_input.c in Linux kernel
1366  switch (m_state)
1367  {
1368  case ESTABLISHED:
1369  ProcessEstablished (packet, tcpHeader);
1370  break;
1371  case LISTEN:
1372  ProcessListen (packet, tcpHeader, fromAddress, toAddress);
1373  break;
1374  case TIME_WAIT:
1375  // Do nothing
1376  break;
1377  case CLOSED:
1378  // Send RST if the incoming packet is not a RST
1379  if ((tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG)) != TcpHeader::RST)
1380  { // Since m_endPoint is not configured yet, we cannot use SendRST here
1381  TcpHeader h;
1382  Ptr<Packet> p = Create<Packet> ();
1383  h.SetFlags (TcpHeader::RST);
1384  h.SetSequenceNumber (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence);
1385  h.SetAckNumber (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
1386  h.SetSourcePort (tcpHeader.GetDestinationPort ());
1387  h.SetDestinationPort (tcpHeader.GetSourcePort ());
1388  h.SetWindowSize (AdvertisedWindowSize ());
1389  AddOptions (h);
1390  m_txTrace (p, h, this);
1391  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, h, toAddress, fromAddress, m_boundnetdevice);
1392  }
1393  break;
1394  case SYN_SENT:
1395  ProcessSynSent (packet, tcpHeader);
1396  break;
1397  case SYN_RCVD:
1398  ProcessSynRcvd (packet, tcpHeader, fromAddress, toAddress);
1399  break;
1400  case FIN_WAIT_1:
1401  case FIN_WAIT_2:
1402  case CLOSE_WAIT:
1403  ProcessWait (packet, tcpHeader);
1404  break;
1405  case CLOSING:
1406  ProcessClosing (packet, tcpHeader);
1407  break;
1408  case LAST_ACK:
1409  ProcessLastAck (packet, tcpHeader);
1410  break;
1411  default: // mute compiler
1412  break;
1413  }
1414 
1415  if (m_rWnd.Get () != 0 && m_persistEvent.IsRunning ())
1416  { // persist probes end, the other end has increased the window
1417  NS_ASSERT (m_connected);
1418  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Leaving zerowindow persist state");
1419  m_persistEvent.Cancel ();
1420 
1421  SendPendingData (m_connected);
1422  }
1423 }
1424 
1425 /* Received a packet upon ESTABLISHED state. This function is mimicking the
1426  role of tcp_rcv_established() in tcp_input.c in Linux kernel. */
1427 void
1428 TcpSocketBase::ProcessEstablished (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
1429 {
1430  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
1431 
1432  // Extract the flags. PSH, URG, CWR and ECE are disregarded.
1433  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG | TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE);
1434 
1435  // Different flags are different events
1436  if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::ACK)
1437  {
1438  if (tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () < m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ())
1439  {
1440  // Case 1: If the ACK is a duplicate (SEG.ACK < SND.UNA), it can be ignored.
1441  // Pag. 72 RFC 793
1442  NS_LOG_WARN ("Ignored ack of " << tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () <<
1443  " SND.UNA = " << m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ());
1444 
1445  // TODO: RFC 5961 5.2 [Blind Data Injection Attack].[Mitigation]
1446  }
1447  else if (tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () > m_tcb->m_highTxMark)
1448  {
1449  // If the ACK acks something not yet sent (SEG.ACK > HighTxMark) then
1450  // send an ACK, drop the segment, and return.
1451  // Pag. 72 RFC 793
1452  NS_LOG_WARN ("Ignored ack of " << tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () <<
1453  " HighTxMark = " << m_tcb->m_highTxMark);
1454 
1455  // Receiver sets ECE flags when it receives a packet with CE bit on or sender hasn’t responded to ECN echo sent by receiver
1456  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
1457  {
1458  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
1459  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_SENDING_ECE");
1460  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
1461  }
1462  else
1463  {
1464  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
1465  }
1466  }
1467  else
1468  {
1469  // SND.UNA < SEG.ACK =< HighTxMark
1470  // Pag. 72 RFC 793
1471  ReceivedAck (packet, tcpHeader);
1472  }
1473  }
1474  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::SYN)
1475  { // Received SYN, old NS-3 behaviour is to set state to SYN_RCVD and
1476  // respond with a SYN+ACK. But it is not a legal state transition as of
1477  // RFC793. Thus this is ignored.
1478  }
1479  else if (tcpflags == (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK))
1480  { // No action for received SYN+ACK, it is probably a duplicated packet
1481  }
1482  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::FIN || tcpflags == (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK))
1483  { // Received FIN or FIN+ACK, bring down this socket nicely
1484  PeerClose (packet, tcpHeader);
1485  }
1486  else if (tcpflags == 0)
1487  { // No flags means there is only data
1488  ReceivedData (packet, tcpHeader);
1489  if (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Finished ())
1490  {
1491  PeerClose (packet, tcpHeader);
1492  }
1493  }
1494  else
1495  { // Received RST or the TCP flags is invalid, in either case, terminate this socket
1496  if (tcpflags != TcpHeader::RST)
1497  { // this must be an invalid flag, send reset
1498  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpflags) << " received. Reset packet is sent.");
1499  SendRST ();
1500  }
1501  CloseAndNotify ();
1502  }
1503 }
1504 
1505 bool
1506 TcpSocketBase::IsTcpOptionEnabled (uint8_t kind) const
1507 {
1508  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << static_cast<uint32_t> (kind));
1509 
1510  switch (kind)
1511  {
1512  case TcpOption::TS:
1513  return m_timestampEnabled;
1514  case TcpOption::WINSCALE:
1515  return m_winScalingEnabled;
1516  case TcpOption::SACKPERMITTED:
1517  case TcpOption::SACK:
1518  return m_sackEnabled;
1519  default:
1520  break;
1521  }
1522  return false;
1523 }
1524 
1525 void
1526 TcpSocketBase::ReadOptions (const TcpHeader &tcpHeader, uint32_t *bytesSacked)
1527 {
1528  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
1529  TcpHeader::TcpOptionList::const_iterator it;
1530  const TcpHeader::TcpOptionList options = tcpHeader.GetOptionList ();
1531 
1532  for (it = options.begin (); it != options.end (); ++it)
1533  {
1534  const Ptr<const TcpOption> option = (*it);
1535 
1536  // Check only for ACK options here
1537  switch (option->GetKind ())
1538  {
1539  case TcpOption::SACK:
1540  *bytesSacked = ProcessOptionSack (option);
1541  break;
1542  default:
1543  continue;
1544  }
1545  }
1546 }
1547 
1548 void
1549 TcpSocketBase::EnterRecovery (uint32_t currentDelivered)
1550 {
1551  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
1552  NS_ASSERT (m_tcb->m_congState != TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY);
1553 
1554  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::TcpCongStateName[m_tcb->m_congState] <<
1555  " -> CA_RECOVERY");
1556 
1557  if (!m_sackEnabled)
1558  {
1559  // One segment has left the network, PLUS the head is lost
1560  m_txBuffer->AddRenoSack ();
1561  m_txBuffer->MarkHeadAsLost ();
1562  }
1563  else
1564  {
1565  if (!m_txBuffer->IsLost (m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ()))
1566  {
1567  // We received 3 dupacks, but the head is not marked as lost
1568  // (received less than 3 SACK block ahead).
1569  // Manually set it as lost.
1570  m_txBuffer->MarkHeadAsLost ();
1571  }
1572  }
1573 
1574  // RFC 6675, point (4):
1575  // (4) Invoke fast retransmit and enter loss recovery as follows:
1576  // (4.1) RecoveryPoint = HighData
1577  m_recover = m_tcb->m_highTxMark;
1578 
1579  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY);
1580  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY;
1581 
1582  // (4.2) ssthresh = cwnd = (FlightSize / 2)
1583  // If SACK is not enabled, still consider the head as 'in flight' for
1584  // compatibility with old ns-3 versions
1585  uint32_t bytesInFlight = m_sackEnabled ? BytesInFlight () : BytesInFlight () + m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1586  m_tcb->m_ssThresh = m_congestionControl->GetSsThresh (m_tcb, bytesInFlight);
1587 
1588  if (!m_congestionControl->HasCongControl ())
1589  {
1590  m_recoveryOps->EnterRecovery (m_tcb, m_dupAckCount, UnAckDataCount (), currentDelivered);
1591  NS_LOG_INFO (m_dupAckCount << " dupack. Enter fast recovery mode." <<
1592  "Reset cwnd to " << m_tcb->m_cWnd << ", ssthresh to " <<
1593  m_tcb->m_ssThresh << " at fast recovery seqnum " << m_recover <<
1594  " calculated in flight: " << bytesInFlight);
1595  }
1596 
1597 
1598  // (4.3) Retransmit the first data segment presumed dropped
1599  DoRetransmit ();
1600  // (4.4) Run SetPipe ()
1601  // (4.5) Proceed to step (C)
1602  // these steps are done after the ProcessAck function (SendPendingData)
1603 }
1604 
1605 void
1606 TcpSocketBase::DupAck (uint32_t currentDelivered)
1607 {
1608  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
1609  // NOTE: We do not count the DupAcks received in CA_LOSS, because we
1610  // don't know if they are generated by a spurious retransmission or because
1611  // of a real packet loss. With SACK, it is easy to know, but we do not consider
1612  // dupacks. Without SACK, there are some euristics in the RFC 6582, but
1613  // for now, we do not implement it, leading to ignoring the dupacks.
1614  if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS)
1615  {
1616  return;
1617  }
1618 
1619  // RFC 6675, Section 5, 3rd paragraph:
1620  // If the incoming ACK is a duplicate acknowledgment per the definition
1621  // in Section 2 (regardless of its status as a cumulative
1622  // acknowledgment), and the TCP is not currently in loss recovery
1623  // the TCP MUST increase DupAcks by one ...
1624  if (m_tcb->m_congState != TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY)
1625  {
1626  ++m_dupAckCount;
1627  }
1628 
1629  if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN)
1630  {
1631  // From Open we go Disorder
1632  NS_ASSERT_MSG (m_dupAckCount == 1, "From OPEN->DISORDER but with " <<
1633  m_dupAckCount << " dup ACKs");
1634 
1635  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_DISORDER);
1636  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_DISORDER;
1637 
1638  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("CA_OPEN -> CA_DISORDER");
1639  }
1640 
1641  if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY)
1642  {
1643  if (!m_sackEnabled)
1644  {
1645  // If we are in recovery and we receive a dupack, one segment
1646  // has left the network. This is equivalent to a SACK of one block.
1647  m_txBuffer->AddRenoSack ();
1648  }
1649  if (!m_congestionControl->HasCongControl ())
1650  {
1651  m_recoveryOps->DoRecovery (m_tcb, currentDelivered);
1652  NS_LOG_INFO (m_dupAckCount << " Dupack received in fast recovery mode."
1653  "Increase cwnd to " << m_tcb->m_cWnd);
1654  }
1655  }
1656  else if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_DISORDER)
1657  {
1658  // RFC 6675, Section 5, continuing:
1659  // ... and take the following steps:
1660  // (1) If DupAcks >= DupThresh, go to step (4).
1661  if ((m_dupAckCount == m_retxThresh) && (m_highRxAckMark >= m_recover))
1662  {
1663  EnterRecovery (currentDelivered);
1664  NS_ASSERT (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY);
1665  }
1666  // (2) If DupAcks < DupThresh but IsLost (HighACK + 1) returns true
1667  // (indicating at least three segments have arrived above the current
1668  // cumulative acknowledgment point, which is taken to indicate loss)
1669  // go to step (4).
1670  else if (m_txBuffer->IsLost (m_highRxAckMark + m_tcb->m_segmentSize))
1671  {
1672  EnterRecovery (currentDelivered);
1673  NS_ASSERT (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY);
1674  }
1675  else
1676  {
1677  // (3) The TCP MAY transmit previously unsent data segments as per
1678  // Limited Transmit [RFC5681] ...except that the number of octets
1679  // which may be sent is governed by pipe and cwnd as follows:
1680  //
1681  // (3.1) Set HighRxt to HighACK.
1682  // Not clear in RFC. We don't do this here, since we still have
1683  // to retransmit the segment.
1684 
1685  if (!m_sackEnabled && m_limitedTx)
1686  {
1687  m_txBuffer->AddRenoSack ();
1688 
1689  // In limited transmit, cwnd Infl is not updated.
1690  }
1691  }
1692  }
1693 }
1694 
1695 /* Process the newly received ACK */
1696 void
1697 TcpSocketBase::ReceivedAck (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
1698 {
1699  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
1700 
1701  NS_ASSERT (0 != (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::ACK));
1702  NS_ASSERT (m_tcb->m_segmentSize > 0);
1703 
1704  // RFC 6675, Section 5, 1st paragraph:
1705  // Upon the receipt of any ACK containing SACK information, the
1706  // scoreboard MUST be updated via the Update () routine (done in ReadOptions)
1707  uint32_t bytesSacked = 0;
1708  uint64_t previousDelivered = m_rateOps->GetConnectionRate ().m_delivered;
1709  ReadOptions (tcpHeader, &bytesSacked);
1710 
1711  SequenceNumber32 ackNumber = tcpHeader.GetAckNumber ();
1712  SequenceNumber32 oldHeadSequence = m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ();
1713  m_txBuffer->DiscardUpTo (ackNumber, MakeCallback (&TcpRateOps::SkbDelivered, m_rateOps));
1714 
1715  uint32_t currentDelivered = static_cast<uint32_t> (m_rateOps->GetConnectionRate ().m_delivered - previousDelivered);
1716 
1717  if (ackNumber > oldHeadSequence && (m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED) && (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::ECE))
1718  {
1719  if (m_ecnEchoSeq < ackNumber)
1720  {
1721  NS_LOG_INFO ("Received ECN Echo is valid");
1722  m_ecnEchoSeq = ackNumber;
1723  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_ECE_RCVD");
1724  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_ECE_RCVD;
1725  }
1726  }
1727  else if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_ECE_RCVD && !(tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::ECE))
1728  {
1729  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
1730  }
1731 
1732  // Update bytes in flight before processing the ACK for proper calculation of congestion window
1733  NS_LOG_INFO ("Update bytes in flight before processing the ACK.");
1734  BytesInFlight ();
1735 
1736  // RFC 6675 Section 5: 2nd, 3rd paragraph and point (A), (B) implementation
1737  // are inside the function ProcessAck
1738  ProcessAck (ackNumber, (bytesSacked > 0), currentDelivered, oldHeadSequence);
1739 
1740  if (m_congestionControl->HasCongControl ())
1741  {
1742  uint32_t previousLost = m_txBuffer->GetLost ();
1743  uint32_t priorInFlight = m_tcb->m_bytesInFlight.Get ();
1744  uint32_t currentLost = m_txBuffer->GetLost ();
1745  uint32_t lost = (currentLost > previousLost) ?
1746  currentLost - previousLost :
1747  previousLost - currentLost;
1748  auto rateSample = m_rateOps->GenerateSample (currentDelivered, lost,
1749  false, priorInFlight, m_tcb->m_minRtt);
1750  auto rateConn = m_rateOps->GetConnectionRate ();
1751  m_congestionControl->CongControl(m_tcb, rateConn, rateSample);
1752  }
1753 
1754  // If there is any data piggybacked, store it into m_rxBuffer
1755  if (packet->GetSize () > 0)
1756  {
1757  ReceivedData (packet, tcpHeader);
1758  }
1759 
1760  // RFC 6675, Section 5, point (C), try to send more data. NB: (C) is implemented
1761  // inside SendPendingData
1762  SendPendingData (m_connected);
1763 }
1764 
1765 void
1766 TcpSocketBase::ProcessAck(const SequenceNumber32 &ackNumber, bool scoreboardUpdated,
1767  uint32_t currentDelivered, const SequenceNumber32 &oldHeadSequence)
1768 {
1769  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << ackNumber << scoreboardUpdated);
1770  // RFC 6675, Section 5, 2nd paragraph:
1771  // If the incoming ACK is a cumulative acknowledgment, the TCP MUST
1772  // reset DupAcks to zero.
1773  bool exitedFastRecovery = false;
1774  uint32_t oldDupAckCount = m_dupAckCount; // remember the old value
1775  m_tcb->m_lastAckedSeq = ackNumber; // Update lastAckedSeq
1776  uint32_t bytesAcked = 0;
1777 
1778  /* In RFC 5681 the definition of duplicate acknowledgment was strict:
1779  *
1780  * (a) the receiver of the ACK has outstanding data,
1781  * (b) the incoming acknowledgment carries no data,
1782  * (c) the SYN and FIN bits are both off,
1783  * (d) the acknowledgment number is equal to the greatest acknowledgment
1784  * received on the given connection (TCP.UNA from [RFC793]),
1785  * (e) the advertised window in the incoming acknowledgment equals the
1786  * advertised window in the last incoming acknowledgment.
1787  *
1788  * With RFC 6675, this definition has been reduced:
1789  *
1790  * (a) the ACK is carrying a SACK block that identifies previously
1791  * unacknowledged and un-SACKed octets between HighACK (TCP.UNA) and
1792  * HighData (m_highTxMark)
1793  */
1794 
1795  bool isDupack = m_sackEnabled ?
1796  scoreboardUpdated
1797  : ackNumber == oldHeadSequence &&
1798  ackNumber < m_tcb->m_highTxMark;
1799 
1800  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("ACK of " << ackNumber <<
1801  " SND.UNA=" << oldHeadSequence <<
1802  " SND.NXT=" << m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence <<
1803  " in state: " << TcpSocketState::TcpCongStateName[m_tcb->m_congState] <<
1804  " with m_recover: " << m_recover);
1805 
1806  // RFC 6675, Section 5, 3rd paragraph:
1807  // If the incoming ACK is a duplicate acknowledgment per the definition
1808  // in Section 2 (regardless of its status as a cumulative
1809  // acknowledgment), and the TCP is not currently in loss recovery
1810  if (isDupack)
1811  {
1812  // loss recovery check is done inside this function thanks to
1813  // the congestion state machine
1814  DupAck (currentDelivered);
1815  }
1816 
1817  if (ackNumber == oldHeadSequence
1818  && ackNumber == m_tcb->m_highTxMark)
1819  {
1820  // Dupack, but the ACK is precisely equal to the nextTxSequence
1821  return;
1822  }
1823  else if (ackNumber == oldHeadSequence
1824  && ackNumber > m_tcb->m_highTxMark)
1825  {
1826  // ACK of the FIN bit ... nextTxSequence is not updated since we
1827  // don't have anything to transmit
1828  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Update nextTxSequence manually to " << ackNumber);
1829  m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence = ackNumber;
1830  }
1831  else if (ackNumber == oldHeadSequence)
1832  {
1833  // DupAck. Artificially call PktsAcked: after all, one segment has been ACKed.
1834  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, 1, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1835  }
1836  else if (ackNumber > oldHeadSequence)
1837  {
1838  // Please remember that, with SACK, we can enter here even if we
1839  // received a dupack.
1840  bytesAcked = ackNumber - oldHeadSequence;
1841  uint32_t segsAcked = bytesAcked / m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1842  m_bytesAckedNotProcessed += bytesAcked % m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1843  bytesAcked -= bytesAcked % m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1844 
1845  if (m_bytesAckedNotProcessed >= m_tcb->m_segmentSize)
1846  {
1847  segsAcked += 1;
1848  bytesAcked += m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1849  m_bytesAckedNotProcessed -= m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1850  }
1851 
1852  // Dupack count is reset to eventually fast-retransmit after 3 dupacks.
1853  // Any SACK-ed segment will be cleaned up by DiscardUpTo.
1854  // In the case that we advanced SND.UNA, but the ack contains SACK blocks,
1855  // we do not reset. At the third one we will retransmit.
1856  // If we are already in recovery, this check is useless since dupAcks
1857  // are not considered in this phase. When from Recovery we go back
1858  // to open, then dupAckCount is reset anyway.
1859  if (!isDupack)
1860  {
1861  m_dupAckCount = 0;
1862  }
1863 
1864  // RFC 6675, Section 5, part (B)
1865  // (B) Upon receipt of an ACK that does not cover RecoveryPoint, the
1866  // following actions MUST be taken:
1867  //
1868  // (B.1) Use Update () to record the new SACK information conveyed
1869  // by the incoming ACK.
1870  // (B.2) Use SetPipe () to re-calculate the number of octets still
1871  // in the network.
1872  //
1873  // (B.1) is done at the beginning, while (B.2) is delayed to part (C) while
1874  // trying to transmit with SendPendingData. We are not allowed to exit
1875  // the CA_RECOVERY phase. Just process this partial ack (RFC 5681)
1876  if (ackNumber < m_recover && m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY)
1877  {
1878  if (!m_sackEnabled)
1879  {
1880  // Manually set the head as lost, it will be retransmitted.
1881  NS_LOG_INFO ("Partial ACK. Manually setting head as lost");
1882  m_txBuffer->MarkHeadAsLost ();
1883  }
1884  else
1885  {
1886  // We received a partial ACK, if we retransmitted this segment
1887  // probably is better to retransmit it
1888  m_txBuffer->DeleteRetransmittedFlagFromHead ();
1889  }
1890  DoRetransmit (); // Assume the next seq is lost. Retransmit lost packet
1891  m_tcb->m_cWndInfl = SafeSubtraction (m_tcb->m_cWndInfl, bytesAcked);
1892  if (!m_congestionControl->HasCongControl () && segsAcked >= 1)
1893  {
1894  m_recoveryOps->DoRecovery (m_tcb, currentDelivered);
1895  }
1896 
1897  // This partial ACK acknowledge the fact that one segment has been
1898  // previously lost and now successfully received. All others have
1899  // been processed when they come under the form of dupACKs
1900  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, 1, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1901  NewAck (ackNumber, m_isFirstPartialAck);
1902 
1903  if (m_isFirstPartialAck)
1904  {
1905  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Partial ACK of " << ackNumber <<
1906  " and this is the first (RTO will be reset);"
1907  " cwnd set to " << m_tcb->m_cWnd <<
1908  " recover seq: " << m_recover <<
1909  " dupAck count: " << m_dupAckCount);
1910  m_isFirstPartialAck = false;
1911  }
1912  else
1913  {
1914  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Partial ACK of " << ackNumber <<
1915  " and this is NOT the first (RTO will not be reset)"
1916  " cwnd set to " << m_tcb->m_cWnd <<
1917  " recover seq: " << m_recover <<
1918  " dupAck count: " << m_dupAckCount);
1919  }
1920  }
1921  // From RFC 6675 section 5.1
1922  // In addition, a new recovery phase (as described in Section 5) MUST NOT
1923  // be initiated until HighACK is greater than or equal to the new value
1924  // of RecoveryPoint.
1925  else if (ackNumber < m_recover && m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS)
1926  {
1927  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, segsAcked, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1928  m_congestionControl->IncreaseWindow (m_tcb, segsAcked);
1929 
1930  NS_LOG_DEBUG (" Cong Control Called, cWnd=" << m_tcb->m_cWnd <<
1931  " ssTh=" << m_tcb->m_ssThresh);
1932  if (!m_sackEnabled)
1933  {
1934  NS_ASSERT_MSG (m_txBuffer->GetSacked () == 0,
1935  "Some segment got dup-acked in CA_LOSS state: " <<
1936  m_txBuffer->GetSacked ());
1937  }
1938  NewAck (ackNumber, true);
1939  }
1940  else
1941  {
1942  if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN)
1943  {
1944  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, segsAcked, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1945  }
1946  else if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_DISORDER)
1947  {
1948  if (segsAcked >= oldDupAckCount)
1949  {
1950  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, segsAcked - oldDupAckCount, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1951  }
1952 
1953  if (!isDupack)
1954  {
1955  // The network reorder packets. Linux changes the counting lost
1956  // packet algorithm from FACK to NewReno. We simply go back in Open.
1957  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
1958  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
1959  NS_LOG_DEBUG (segsAcked << " segments acked in CA_DISORDER, ack of " <<
1960  ackNumber << " exiting CA_DISORDER -> CA_OPEN");
1961  }
1962  else
1963  {
1964  NS_LOG_DEBUG (segsAcked << " segments acked in CA_DISORDER, ack of " <<
1965  ackNumber << " but still in CA_DISORDER");
1966  }
1967  }
1968  // RFC 6675, Section 5:
1969  // Once a TCP is in the loss recovery phase, the following procedure
1970  // MUST be used for each arriving ACK:
1971  // (A) An incoming cumulative ACK for a sequence number greater than
1972  // RecoveryPoint signals the end of loss recovery, and the loss
1973  // recovery phase MUST be terminated. Any information contained in
1974  // the scoreboard for sequence numbers greater than the new value of
1975  // HighACK SHOULD NOT be cleared when leaving the loss recovery
1976  // phase.
1977  else if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY)
1978  {
1979  m_isFirstPartialAck = true;
1980 
1981  // Recalculate the segs acked, that are from m_recover to ackNumber
1982  // (which are the ones we have not passed to PktsAcked and that
1983  // can increase cWnd)
1984  segsAcked = static_cast<uint32_t>(ackNumber - m_recover) / m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
1985  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, segsAcked, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
1986  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_COMPLETE_CWR);
1987  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
1988  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
1989  exitedFastRecovery = true;
1990  m_dupAckCount = 0; // From recovery to open, reset dupack
1991 
1992  NS_LOG_DEBUG (segsAcked << " segments acked in CA_RECOVER, ack of " <<
1993  ackNumber << ", exiting CA_RECOVERY -> CA_OPEN");
1994  }
1995  else if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS)
1996  {
1997  m_isFirstPartialAck = true;
1998 
1999  // Recalculate the segs acked, that are from m_recover to ackNumber
2000  // (which are the ones we have not passed to PktsAcked and that
2001  // can increase cWnd)
2002  segsAcked = (ackNumber - m_recover) / m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
2003 
2004  m_congestionControl->PktsAcked (m_tcb, segsAcked, m_tcb->m_lastRtt);
2005 
2006  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
2007  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
2008  NS_LOG_DEBUG (segsAcked << " segments acked in CA_LOSS, ack of" <<
2009  ackNumber << ", exiting CA_LOSS -> CA_OPEN");
2010  }
2011 
2012  if (exitedFastRecovery)
2013  {
2014  NewAck (ackNumber, true);
2015  m_recoveryOps->ExitRecovery (m_tcb);
2016  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Leaving Fast Recovery; BytesInFlight() = " <<
2017  BytesInFlight () << "; cWnd = " << m_tcb->m_cWnd);
2018  }
2019  else
2020  {
2021  m_congestionControl->IncreaseWindow (m_tcb, segsAcked);
2022 
2023  m_tcb->m_cWndInfl = m_tcb->m_cWnd;
2024 
2025  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Congestion control called: " <<
2026  " cWnd: " << m_tcb->m_cWnd <<
2027  " ssTh: " << m_tcb->m_ssThresh <<
2028  " segsAcked: " << segsAcked);
2029 
2030  NewAck (ackNumber, true);
2031  }
2032  }
2033  }
2034 }
2035 
2036 /* Received a packet upon LISTEN state. */
2037 void
2038 TcpSocketBase::ProcessListen (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader,
2039  const Address& fromAddress, const Address& toAddress)
2040 {
2041  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2042 
2043  // Extract the flags. PSH, URG, CWR and ECE are disregarded.
2044  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG | TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE);
2045 
2046  // Fork a socket if received a SYN. Do nothing otherwise.
2047  // C.f.: the LISTEN part in tcp_v4_do_rcv() in tcp_ipv4.c in Linux kernel
2048  if (tcpflags != TcpHeader::SYN)
2049  {
2050  return;
2051  }
2052 
2053  // Call socket's notify function to let the server app know we got a SYN
2054  // If the server app refuses the connection, do nothing
2055  if (!NotifyConnectionRequest (fromAddress))
2056  {
2057  return;
2058  }
2059  // Clone the socket, simulate fork
2060  Ptr<TcpSocketBase> newSock = Fork ();
2061  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Cloned a TcpSocketBase " << newSock);
2062  Simulator::ScheduleNow (&TcpSocketBase::CompleteFork, newSock,
2063  packet, tcpHeader, fromAddress, toAddress);
2064 }
2065 
2066 /* Received a packet upon SYN_SENT */
2067 void
2068 TcpSocketBase::ProcessSynSent (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
2069 {
2070  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2071 
2072  // Extract the flags. PSH and URG are disregarded.
2073  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG);
2074 
2075  if (tcpflags == 0)
2076  { // Bare data, accept it and move to ESTABLISHED state. This is not a normal behaviour. Remove this?
2077  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SYN_SENT -> ESTABLISHED");
2078  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
2079  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
2080  m_state = ESTABLISHED;
2081  m_connected = true;
2082  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
2083  m_delAckCount = m_delAckMaxCount;
2084  ReceivedData (packet, tcpHeader);
2085  Simulator::ScheduleNow (&TcpSocketBase::ConnectionSucceeded, this);
2086  }
2087  else if (tcpflags & TcpHeader::ACK && !(tcpflags & TcpHeader::SYN))
2088  { // Ignore ACK in SYN_SENT
2089  }
2090  else if (tcpflags & TcpHeader::SYN && !(tcpflags & TcpHeader::ACK))
2091  { // Received SYN, move to SYN_RCVD state and respond with SYN+ACK
2092  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SYN_SENT -> SYN_RCVD");
2093  m_state = SYN_RCVD;
2094  m_synCount = m_synRetries;
2095  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetNextRxSequence (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (1));
2096  /* Check if we received an ECN SYN packet. Change the ECN state of receiver to ECN_IDLE if the traffic is ECN capable and
2097  * sender has sent ECN SYN packet
2098  */
2099 
2100  if (m_tcb->m_useEcn != TcpSocketState::Off && (tcpflags & (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE)) == (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE))
2101  {
2102  NS_LOG_INFO ("Received ECN SYN packet");
2103  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
2104  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_IDLE");
2105  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
2106  }
2107  else
2108  {
2109  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED;
2110  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK);
2111  }
2112  }
2113  else if (tcpflags & (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK)
2114  && m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence + SequenceNumber32 (1) == tcpHeader.GetAckNumber ())
2115  { // Handshake completed
2116  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SYN_SENT -> ESTABLISHED");
2117  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
2118  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
2119  m_state = ESTABLISHED;
2120  m_connected = true;
2121  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
2122  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetNextRxSequence (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (1));
2123  m_tcb->m_highTxMark = ++m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence;
2124  m_txBuffer->SetHeadSequence (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence);
2125  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
2126 
2127  /* Check if we received an ECN SYN-ACK packet. Change the ECN state of sender to ECN_IDLE if receiver has sent an ECN SYN-ACK
2128  * packet and the traffic is ECN Capable
2129  */
2130  if (m_tcb->m_useEcn != TcpSocketState::Off && (tcpflags & (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE)) == (TcpHeader::ECE))
2131  {
2132  NS_LOG_INFO ("Received ECN SYN-ACK packet.");
2133  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_IDLE");
2134  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
2135  }
2136  else
2137  {
2138  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED;
2139  }
2140  SendPendingData (m_connected);
2141  Simulator::ScheduleNow (&TcpSocketBase::ConnectionSucceeded, this);
2142  // Always respond to first data packet to speed up the connection.
2143  // Remove to get the behaviour of old NS-3 code.
2144  m_delAckCount = m_delAckMaxCount;
2145  }
2146  else
2147  { // Other in-sequence input
2148  if (!(tcpflags & TcpHeader::RST))
2149  { // When (1) rx of FIN+ACK; (2) rx of FIN; (3) rx of bad flags
2150  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag combination " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpHeader.GetFlags ()) <<
2151  " received in SYN_SENT. Reset packet is sent.");
2152  SendRST ();
2153  }
2154  CloseAndNotify ();
2155  }
2156 }
2157 
2158 /* Received a packet upon SYN_RCVD */
2159 void
2160 TcpSocketBase::ProcessSynRcvd (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader,
2161  const Address& fromAddress, const Address& toAddress)
2162 {
2163  NS_UNUSED (toAddress);
2164  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2165 
2166  // Extract the flags. PSH, URG, CWR and ECE are disregarded.
2167  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG | TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE);
2168 
2169  if (tcpflags == 0
2170  || (tcpflags == TcpHeader::ACK
2171  && m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence + SequenceNumber32 (1) == tcpHeader.GetAckNumber ()))
2172  { // If it is bare data, accept it and move to ESTABLISHED state. This is
2173  // possibly due to ACK lost in 3WHS. If in-sequence ACK is received, the
2174  // handshake is completed nicely.
2175  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SYN_RCVD -> ESTABLISHED");
2176  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN);
2177  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN;
2178  m_state = ESTABLISHED;
2179  m_connected = true;
2180  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
2181  m_tcb->m_highTxMark = ++m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence;
2182  m_txBuffer->SetHeadSequence (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence);
2183  if (m_endPoint)
2184  {
2185  m_endPoint->SetPeer (InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv4 (),
2186  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2187  }
2188  else if (m_endPoint6)
2189  {
2190  m_endPoint6->SetPeer (Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv6 (),
2191  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2192  }
2193  // Always respond to first data packet to speed up the connection.
2194  // Remove to get the behaviour of old NS-3 code.
2195  m_delAckCount = m_delAckMaxCount;
2196  NotifyNewConnectionCreated (this, fromAddress);
2197  ReceivedAck (packet, tcpHeader);
2198  // As this connection is established, the socket is available to send data now
2199  if (GetTxAvailable () > 0)
2200  {
2201  NotifySend (GetTxAvailable ());
2202  }
2203  }
2204  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::SYN)
2205  { // Probably the peer lost my SYN+ACK
2206  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetNextRxSequence (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (1));
2207  /* Check if we received an ECN SYN packet. Change the ECN state of receiver to ECN_IDLE if sender has sent an ECN SYN
2208  * packet and the traffic is ECN Capable
2209  */
2210  if (m_tcb->m_useEcn != TcpSocketState::Off && (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE)) == (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE))
2211  {
2212  NS_LOG_INFO ("Received ECN SYN packet");
2213  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK |TcpHeader::ECE);
2214  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_IDLE");
2215  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
2216  }
2217  else
2218  {
2219  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED;
2220  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK);
2221  }
2222  }
2223  else if (tcpflags == (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK))
2224  {
2225  if (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () == m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ())
2226  { // In-sequence FIN before connection complete. Set up connection and close.
2227  m_connected = true;
2228  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
2229  m_tcb->m_highTxMark = ++m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence;
2230  m_txBuffer->SetHeadSequence (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence);
2231  if (m_endPoint)
2232  {
2233  m_endPoint->SetPeer (InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv4 (),
2234  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2235  }
2236  else if (m_endPoint6)
2237  {
2238  m_endPoint6->SetPeer (Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv6 (),
2239  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2240  }
2241  NotifyNewConnectionCreated (this, fromAddress);
2242  PeerClose (packet, tcpHeader);
2243  }
2244  }
2245  else
2246  { // Other in-sequence input
2247  if (tcpflags != TcpHeader::RST)
2248  { // When (1) rx of SYN+ACK; (2) rx of FIN; (3) rx of bad flags
2249  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpflags) <<
2250  " received. Reset packet is sent.");
2251  if (m_endPoint)
2252  {
2253  m_endPoint->SetPeer (InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv4 (),
2254  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2255  }
2256  else if (m_endPoint6)
2257  {
2258  m_endPoint6->SetPeer (Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv6 (),
2259  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2260  }
2261  SendRST ();
2262  }
2263  CloseAndNotify ();
2264  }
2265 }
2266 
2267 /* Received a packet upon CLOSE_WAIT, FIN_WAIT_1, or FIN_WAIT_2 states */
2268 void
2269 TcpSocketBase::ProcessWait (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
2270 {
2271  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2272 
2273  // Extract the flags. PSH, URG, CWR and ECE are disregarded.
2274  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG | TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE);
2275 
2276  if (packet->GetSize () > 0 && !(tcpflags & TcpHeader::ACK))
2277  { // Bare data, accept it
2278  ReceivedData (packet, tcpHeader);
2279  }
2280  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::ACK)
2281  { // Process the ACK, and if in FIN_WAIT_1, conditionally move to FIN_WAIT_2
2282  ReceivedAck (packet, tcpHeader);
2283  if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_1 && m_txBuffer->Size () == 0
2284  && tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () == m_tcb->m_highTxMark + SequenceNumber32 (1))
2285  { // This ACK corresponds to the FIN sent
2286  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("FIN_WAIT_1 -> FIN_WAIT_2");
2287  m_state = FIN_WAIT_2;
2288  }
2289  }
2290  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::FIN || tcpflags == (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK))
2291  { // Got FIN, respond with ACK and move to next state
2292  if (tcpflags & TcpHeader::ACK)
2293  { // Process the ACK first
2294  ReceivedAck (packet, tcpHeader);
2295  }
2296  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetFinSequence (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber ());
2297  }
2298  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::SYN || tcpflags == (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK))
2299  { // Duplicated SYN or SYN+ACK, possibly due to spurious retransmission
2300  return;
2301  }
2302  else
2303  { // This is a RST or bad flags
2304  if (tcpflags != TcpHeader::RST)
2305  {
2306  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpflags) <<
2307  " received. Reset packet is sent.");
2308  SendRST ();
2309  }
2310  CloseAndNotify ();
2311  return;
2312  }
2313 
2314  // Check if the close responder sent an in-sequence FIN, if so, respond ACK
2315  if ((m_state == FIN_WAIT_1 || m_state == FIN_WAIT_2) && m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Finished ())
2316  {
2317  if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_1)
2318  {
2319  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("FIN_WAIT_1 -> CLOSING");
2320  m_state = CLOSING;
2321  if (m_txBuffer->Size () == 0
2322  && tcpHeader.GetAckNumber () == m_tcb->m_highTxMark + SequenceNumber32 (1))
2323  { // This ACK corresponds to the FIN sent
2324  TimeWait ();
2325  }
2326  }
2327  else if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_2)
2328  {
2329  TimeWait ();
2330  }
2331  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
2332  if (!m_shutdownRecv)
2333  {
2334  NotifyDataRecv ();
2335  }
2336  }
2337 }
2338 
2339 /* Received a packet upon CLOSING */
2340 void
2341 TcpSocketBase::ProcessClosing (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
2342 {
2343  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2344 
2345  // Extract the flags. PSH and URG are disregarded.
2346  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG);
2347 
2348  if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::ACK)
2349  {
2350  if (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () == m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ())
2351  { // This ACK corresponds to the FIN sent
2352  TimeWait ();
2353  }
2354  }
2355  else
2356  { // CLOSING state means simultaneous close, i.e. no one is sending data to
2357  // anyone. If anything other than ACK is received, respond with a reset.
2358  if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::FIN || tcpflags == (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK))
2359  { // FIN from the peer as well. We can close immediately.
2360  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
2361  }
2362  else if (tcpflags != TcpHeader::RST)
2363  { // Receive of SYN or SYN+ACK or bad flags or pure data
2364  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpflags) << " received. Reset packet is sent.");
2365  SendRST ();
2366  }
2367  CloseAndNotify ();
2368  }
2369 }
2370 
2371 /* Received a packet upon LAST_ACK */
2372 void
2373 TcpSocketBase::ProcessLastAck (Ptr<Packet> packet, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
2374 {
2375  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2376 
2377  // Extract the flags. PSH and URG are disregarded.
2378  uint8_t tcpflags = tcpHeader.GetFlags () & ~(TcpHeader::PSH | TcpHeader::URG);
2379 
2380  if (tcpflags == 0)
2381  {
2382  ReceivedData (packet, tcpHeader);
2383  }
2384  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::ACK)
2385  {
2386  if (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () == m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ())
2387  { // This ACK corresponds to the FIN sent. This socket closed peacefully.
2388  CloseAndNotify ();
2389  }
2390  }
2391  else if (tcpflags == TcpHeader::FIN)
2392  { // Received FIN again, the peer probably lost the FIN+ACK
2393  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK);
2394  }
2395  else if (tcpflags == (TcpHeader::FIN | TcpHeader::ACK) || tcpflags == TcpHeader::RST)
2396  {
2397  CloseAndNotify ();
2398  }
2399  else
2400  { // Received a SYN or SYN+ACK or bad flags
2401  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Illegal flag " << TcpHeader::FlagsToString (tcpflags) << " received. Reset packet is sent.");
2402  SendRST ();
2403  CloseAndNotify ();
2404  }
2405 }
2406 
2407 /* Peer sent me a FIN. Remember its sequence in rx buffer. */
2408 void
2409 TcpSocketBase::PeerClose (Ptr<Packet> p, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
2410 {
2411  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
2412 
2413  // Ignore all out of range packets
2414  if (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () < m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ()
2415  || tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () > m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxRxSequence ())
2416  {
2417  return;
2418  }
2419  // For any case, remember the FIN position in rx buffer first
2420  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetFinSequence (tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (p->GetSize ()));
2421  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Accepted FIN at seq " << tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (p->GetSize ()));
2422  // If there is any piggybacked data, process it
2423  if (p->GetSize ())
2424  {
2425  ReceivedData (p, tcpHeader);
2426  }
2427  // Return if FIN is out of sequence, otherwise move to CLOSE_WAIT state by DoPeerClose
2428  if (!m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Finished ())
2429  {
2430  return;
2431  }
2432 
2433  // Simultaneous close: Application invoked Close() when we are processing this FIN packet
2434  if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_1)
2435  {
2436  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("FIN_WAIT_1 -> CLOSING");
2437  m_state = CLOSING;
2438  return;
2439  }
2440 
2441  DoPeerClose (); // Change state, respond with ACK
2442 }
2443 
2444 /* Received a in-sequence FIN. Close down this socket. */
2445 void
2446 TcpSocketBase::DoPeerClose (void)
2447 {
2448  NS_ASSERT (m_state == ESTABLISHED || m_state == SYN_RCVD ||
2449  m_state == FIN_WAIT_1 || m_state == FIN_WAIT_2);
2450 
2451  // Move the state to CLOSE_WAIT
2452  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpStateName[m_state] << " -> CLOSE_WAIT");
2453  m_state = CLOSE_WAIT;
2454 
2455  if (!m_closeNotified)
2456  {
2457  // The normal behaviour for an application is that, when the peer sent a in-sequence
2458  // FIN, the app should prepare to close. The app has two choices at this point: either
2459  // respond with ShutdownSend() call to declare that it has nothing more to send and
2460  // the socket can be closed immediately; or remember the peer's close request, wait
2461  // until all its existing data are pushed into the TCP socket, then call Close()
2462  // explicitly.
2463  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("TCP " << this << " calling NotifyNormalClose");
2464  NotifyNormalClose ();
2465  m_closeNotified = true;
2466  }
2467  if (m_shutdownSend)
2468  { // The application declares that it would not sent any more, close this socket
2469  Close ();
2470  }
2471  else
2472  { // Need to ack, the application will close later
2473  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
2474  }
2475  if (m_state == LAST_ACK)
2476  {
2477  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("TcpSocketBase " << this << " scheduling LATO1");
2478  Time lastRto = m_rtt->GetEstimate () + Max (m_clockGranularity, m_rtt->GetVariation () * 4);
2479  m_lastAckEvent = Simulator::Schedule (lastRto, &TcpSocketBase::LastAckTimeout, this);
2480  }
2481 }
2482 
2483 /* Kill this socket. This is a callback function configured to m_endpoint in
2484  SetupCallback(), invoked when the endpoint is destroyed. */
2485 void
2486 TcpSocketBase::Destroy (void)
2487 {
2488  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
2489  m_endPoint = nullptr;
2490  if (m_tcp != nullptr)
2491  {
2492  m_tcp->RemoveSocket (this);
2493  }
2494  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Cancelled ReTxTimeout event which was set to expire at " <<
2495  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_retxEvent)).GetSeconds ());
2496  CancelAllTimers ();
2497 }
2498 
2499 /* Kill this socket. This is a callback function configured to m_endpoint in
2500  SetupCallback(), invoked when the endpoint is destroyed. */
2501 void
2502 TcpSocketBase::Destroy6 (void)
2503 {
2504  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
2505  m_endPoint6 = nullptr;
2506  if (m_tcp != nullptr)
2507  {
2508  m_tcp->RemoveSocket (this);
2509  }
2510  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Cancelled ReTxTimeout event which was set to expire at " <<
2511  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_retxEvent)).GetSeconds ());
2512  CancelAllTimers ();
2513 }
2514 
2515 /* Send an empty packet with specified TCP flags */
2516 void
2517 TcpSocketBase::SendEmptyPacket (uint8_t flags)
2518 {
2519  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << static_cast<uint32_t> (flags));
2520 
2521  if (m_endPoint == nullptr && m_endPoint6 == nullptr)
2522  {
2523  NS_LOG_WARN ("Failed to send empty packet due to null endpoint");
2524  return;
2525  }
2526 
2527  Ptr<Packet> p = Create<Packet> ();
2528  TcpHeader header;
2529  SequenceNumber32 s = m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence;
2530 
2531  if (flags & TcpHeader::FIN)
2532  {
2533  flags |= TcpHeader::ACK;
2534  }
2535  else if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_1 || m_state == LAST_ACK || m_state == CLOSING)
2536  {
2537  ++s;
2538  }
2539 
2540  AddSocketTags (p);
2541 
2542  header.SetFlags (flags);
2543  header.SetSequenceNumber (s);
2544  header.SetAckNumber (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
2545  if (m_endPoint != nullptr)
2546  {
2547  header.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint->GetLocalPort ());
2548  header.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint->GetPeerPort ());
2549  }
2550  else
2551  {
2552  header.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint6->GetLocalPort ());
2553  header.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint6->GetPeerPort ());
2554  }
2555  AddOptions (header);
2556 
2557  // RFC 6298, clause 2.4
2558  m_rto = Max (m_rtt->GetEstimate () + Max (m_clockGranularity, m_rtt->GetVariation () * 4), m_minRto);
2559 
2560  uint16_t windowSize = AdvertisedWindowSize ();
2561  bool hasSyn = flags & TcpHeader::SYN;
2562  bool hasFin = flags & TcpHeader::FIN;
2563  bool isAck = flags == TcpHeader::ACK;
2564  if (hasSyn)
2565  {
2566  if (m_winScalingEnabled)
2567  { // The window scaling option is set only on SYN packets
2568  AddOptionWScale (header);
2569  }
2570 
2571  if (m_sackEnabled)
2572  {
2573  AddOptionSackPermitted (header);
2574  }
2575 
2576  if (m_synCount == 0)
2577  { // No more connection retries, give up
2578  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Connection failed.");
2579  m_rtt->Reset (); //According to recommendation -> RFC 6298
2580  CloseAndNotify ();
2581  return;
2582  }
2583  else
2584  { // Exponential backoff of connection time out
2585  int backoffCount = 0x1 << (m_synRetries - m_synCount);
2586  m_rto = m_cnTimeout * backoffCount;
2587  m_synCount--;
2588  }
2589 
2590  if (m_synRetries - 1 == m_synCount)
2591  {
2592  UpdateRttHistory (s, 0, false);
2593  }
2594  else
2595  { // This is SYN retransmission
2596  UpdateRttHistory (s, 0, true);
2597  }
2598 
2599  windowSize = AdvertisedWindowSize (false);
2600  }
2601  header.SetWindowSize (windowSize);
2602 
2603  if (flags & TcpHeader::ACK)
2604  { // If sending an ACK, cancel the delay ACK as well
2605  m_delAckEvent.Cancel ();
2606  m_delAckCount = 0;
2607  if (m_highTxAck < header.GetAckNumber ())
2608  {
2609  m_highTxAck = header.GetAckNumber ();
2610  }
2611  if (m_sackEnabled && m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->GetSackListSize () > 0)
2612  {
2613  AddOptionSack (header);
2614  }
2615  NS_LOG_INFO ("Sending a pure ACK, acking seq " << m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
2616  }
2617 
2618  m_txTrace (p, header, this);
2619 
2620  if (m_endPoint != nullptr)
2621  {
2622  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, header, m_endPoint->GetLocalAddress (),
2623  m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
2624  }
2625  else
2626  {
2627  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, header, m_endPoint6->GetLocalAddress (),
2628  m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
2629  }
2630 
2631 
2632  if (m_retxEvent.IsExpired () && (hasSyn || hasFin) && !isAck )
2633  { // Retransmit SYN / SYN+ACK / FIN / FIN+ACK to guard against lost
2634  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Schedule retransmission timeout at time "
2635  << Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds () << " to expire at time "
2636  << (Simulator::Now () + m_rto.Get ()).GetSeconds ());
2637  m_retxEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_rto, &TcpSocketBase::SendEmptyPacket, this, flags);
2638  }
2639 }
2640 
2641 /* This function closes the endpoint completely. Called upon RST_TX action. */
2642 void
2643 TcpSocketBase::SendRST (void)
2644 {
2645  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
2646  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::RST);
2647  NotifyErrorClose ();
2648  DeallocateEndPoint ();
2649 }
2650 
2651 /* Deallocate the end point and cancel all the timers */
2652 void
2653 TcpSocketBase::DeallocateEndPoint (void)
2654 {
2655  if (m_endPoint != nullptr)
2656  {
2657  CancelAllTimers ();
2658  m_endPoint->SetDestroyCallback (MakeNullCallback<void> ());
2659  m_tcp->DeAllocate (m_endPoint);
2660  m_endPoint = nullptr;
2661  m_tcp->RemoveSocket (this);
2662  }
2663  else if (m_endPoint6 != nullptr)
2664  {
2665  CancelAllTimers ();
2666  m_endPoint6->SetDestroyCallback (MakeNullCallback<void> ());
2667  m_tcp->DeAllocate (m_endPoint6);
2668  m_endPoint6 = nullptr;
2669  m_tcp->RemoveSocket (this);
2670  }
2671 }
2672 
2673 /* Configure the endpoint to a local address. Called by Connect() if Bind() didn't specify one. */
2674 int
2675 TcpSocketBase::SetupEndpoint ()
2676 {
2677  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
2678  Ptr<Ipv4> ipv4 = m_node->GetObject<Ipv4> ();
2679  NS_ASSERT (ipv4 != nullptr);
2680  if (ipv4->GetRoutingProtocol () == nullptr)
2681  {
2682  NS_FATAL_ERROR ("No Ipv4RoutingProtocol in the node");
2683  }
2684  // Create a dummy packet, then ask the routing function for the best output
2685  // interface's address
2686  Ipv4Header header;
2687  header.SetDestination (m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress ());
2688  Socket::SocketErrno errno_;
2689  Ptr<Ipv4Route> route;
2690  Ptr<NetDevice> oif = m_boundnetdevice;
2691  route = ipv4->GetRoutingProtocol ()->RouteOutput (Ptr<Packet> (), header, oif, errno_);
2692  if (route == 0)
2693  {
2694  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Route to " << m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress () << " does not exist");
2695  NS_LOG_ERROR (errno_);
2696  m_errno = errno_;
2697  return -1;
2698  }
2699  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Route exists");
2700  m_endPoint->SetLocalAddress (route->GetSource ());
2701  return 0;
2702 }
2703 
2704 int
2705 TcpSocketBase::SetupEndpoint6 ()
2706 {
2707  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
2708  Ptr<Ipv6L3Protocol> ipv6 = m_node->GetObject<Ipv6L3Protocol> ();
2709  NS_ASSERT (ipv6 != nullptr);
2710  if (ipv6->GetRoutingProtocol () == nullptr)
2711  {
2712  NS_FATAL_ERROR ("No Ipv6RoutingProtocol in the node");
2713  }
2714  // Create a dummy packet, then ask the routing function for the best output
2715  // interface's address
2716  Ipv6Header header;
2717  header.SetDestinationAddress (m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress ());
2718  Socket::SocketErrno errno_;
2719  Ptr<Ipv6Route> route;
2720  Ptr<NetDevice> oif = m_boundnetdevice;
2721  route = ipv6->GetRoutingProtocol ()->RouteOutput (Ptr<Packet> (), header, oif, errno_);
2722  if (route == nullptr)
2723  {
2724  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Route to " << m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress () << " does not exist");
2725  NS_LOG_ERROR (errno_);
2726  m_errno = errno_;
2727  return -1;
2728  }
2729  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Route exists");
2730  m_endPoint6->SetLocalAddress (route->GetSource ());
2731  return 0;
2732 }
2733 
2734 /* This function is called only if a SYN received in LISTEN state. After
2735  TcpSocketBase cloned, allocate a new end point to handle the incoming
2736  connection and send a SYN+ACK to complete the handshake. */
2737 void
2738 TcpSocketBase::CompleteFork (Ptr<Packet> p, const TcpHeader& h,
2739  const Address& fromAddress, const Address& toAddress)
2740 {
2741  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << p << h << fromAddress << toAddress);
2742  NS_UNUSED (p);
2743  // Get port and address from peer (connecting host)
2744  if (InetSocketAddress::IsMatchingType (toAddress))
2745  {
2746  m_endPoint = m_tcp->Allocate (GetBoundNetDevice (),
2747  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (toAddress).GetIpv4 (),
2748  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (toAddress).GetPort (),
2749  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv4 (),
2750  InetSocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2751  m_endPoint6 = nullptr;
2752  }
2753  else if (Inet6SocketAddress::IsMatchingType (toAddress))
2754  {
2755  m_endPoint6 = m_tcp->Allocate6 (GetBoundNetDevice (),
2756  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (toAddress).GetIpv6 (),
2757  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (toAddress).GetPort (),
2758  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetIpv6 (),
2759  Inet6SocketAddress::ConvertFrom (fromAddress).GetPort ());
2760  m_endPoint = nullptr;
2761  }
2762  m_tcp->AddSocket (this);
2763 
2764  // Change the cloned socket from LISTEN state to SYN_RCVD
2765  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("LISTEN -> SYN_RCVD");
2766  m_state = SYN_RCVD;
2767  m_synCount = m_synRetries;
2768  m_dataRetrCount = m_dataRetries;
2769  SetupCallback ();
2770  // Set the sequence number and send SYN+ACK
2771  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetNextRxSequence (h.GetSequenceNumber () + SequenceNumber32 (1));
2772 
2773  /* Check if we received an ECN SYN packet. Change the ECN state of receiver to ECN_IDLE if sender has sent an ECN SYN
2774  * packet and the traffic is ECN Capable
2775  */
2776  if (m_tcb->m_useEcn != TcpSocketState::Off &&
2777  (h.GetFlags () & (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE)) == (TcpHeader::CWR | TcpHeader::ECE))
2778  {
2779  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
2780  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_IDLE");
2781  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_IDLE;
2782  }
2783  else
2784  {
2785  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ACK);
2786  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED;
2787  }
2788 }
2789 
2790 void
2791 TcpSocketBase::ConnectionSucceeded ()
2792 { // Wrapper to protected function NotifyConnectionSucceeded() so that it can
2793  // be called as a scheduled event
2794  NotifyConnectionSucceeded ();
2795  // The if-block below was moved from ProcessSynSent() to here because we need
2796  // to invoke the NotifySend() only after NotifyConnectionSucceeded() to
2797  // reflect the behaviour in the real world.
2798  if (GetTxAvailable () > 0)
2799  {
2800  NotifySend (GetTxAvailable ());
2801  }
2802 }
2803 
2804 void
2805 TcpSocketBase::AddSocketTags (const Ptr<Packet> &p) const
2806 {
2807  /*
2808  * Add tags for each socket option.
2809  * Note that currently the socket adds both IPv4 tag and IPv6 tag
2810  * if both options are set. Once the packet got to layer three, only
2811  * the corresponding tags will be read.
2812  */
2813  if (GetIpTos ())
2814  {
2815  SocketIpTosTag ipTosTag;
2816  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED && !CheckNoEcn (GetIpTos ()))
2817  {
2818  ipTosTag.SetTos (MarkEcnCodePoint (GetIpTos (), m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
2819  }
2820  else
2821  {
2822  // Set the last received ipTos
2823  ipTosTag.SetTos (GetIpTos ());
2824  }
2825  p->AddPacketTag (ipTosTag);
2826  }
2827  else
2828  {
2829  if ((m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED && p->GetSize () > 0) || m_tcb->m_ecnMode == TcpSocketState::DctcpEcn)
2830  {
2831  SocketIpTosTag ipTosTag;
2832  ipTosTag.SetTos (MarkEcnCodePoint (GetIpTos (), m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
2833  p->AddPacketTag (ipTosTag);
2834  }
2835  }
2836 
2837  if (IsManualIpv6Tclass ())
2838  {
2839  SocketIpv6TclassTag ipTclassTag;
2840  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED && !CheckNoEcn (GetIpv6Tclass ()))
2841  {
2842  ipTclassTag.SetTclass (MarkEcnCodePoint (GetIpv6Tclass (), m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
2843  }
2844  else
2845  {
2846  // Set the last received ipTos
2847  ipTclassTag.SetTclass (GetIpv6Tclass ());
2848  }
2849  p->AddPacketTag (ipTclassTag);
2850  }
2851  else
2852  {
2853  if ((m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED && p->GetSize () > 0) || m_tcb->m_ecnMode == TcpSocketState::DctcpEcn)
2854  {
2855  SocketIpv6TclassTag ipTclassTag;
2856  ipTclassTag.SetTclass (MarkEcnCodePoint (GetIpv6Tclass (), m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
2857  p->AddPacketTag (ipTclassTag);
2858  }
2859  }
2860 
2861  if (IsManualIpTtl ())
2862  {
2863  SocketIpTtlTag ipTtlTag;
2864  ipTtlTag.SetTtl (GetIpTtl ());
2865  p->AddPacketTag (ipTtlTag);
2866  }
2867 
2868  if (IsManualIpv6HopLimit ())
2869  {
2870  SocketIpv6HopLimitTag ipHopLimitTag;
2871  ipHopLimitTag.SetHopLimit (GetIpv6HopLimit ());
2872  p->AddPacketTag (ipHopLimitTag);
2873  }
2874 
2875  uint8_t priority = GetPriority ();
2876  if (priority)
2877  {
2878  SocketPriorityTag priorityTag;
2879  priorityTag.SetPriority (priority);
2880  p->ReplacePacketTag (priorityTag);
2881  }
2882 }
2883 
2884 /* Extract at most maxSize bytes from the TxBuffer at sequence seq, add the
2885  TCP header, and send to TcpL4Protocol */
2886 uint32_t
2887 TcpSocketBase::SendDataPacket (SequenceNumber32 seq, uint32_t maxSize, bool withAck)
2888 {
2889  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << seq << maxSize << withAck);
2890 
2891  bool isStartOfTransmission = BytesInFlight () == 0U;
2892  TcpTxItem *outItem = m_txBuffer->CopyFromSequence (maxSize, seq);
2893 
2894  m_rateOps->SkbSent(outItem, isStartOfTransmission);
2895 
2896  bool isRetransmission = outItem->IsRetrans ();
2897  Ptr<Packet> p = outItem->GetPacketCopy ();
2898  uint32_t sz = p->GetSize (); // Size of packet
2899  uint8_t flags = withAck ? TcpHeader::ACK : 0;
2900  uint32_t remainingData = m_txBuffer->SizeFromSequence (seq + SequenceNumber32 (sz));
2901 
2902  if (m_tcb->m_pacing)
2903  {
2904  NS_LOG_INFO ("Pacing is enabled");
2905  if (m_pacingTimer.IsExpired ())
2906  {
2907  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Current Pacing Rate " << m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate);
2908  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Timer is in expired state, activate it " << m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate.CalculateBytesTxTime (sz));
2909  m_pacingTimer.Schedule (m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate.CalculateBytesTxTime (sz));
2910  }
2911  else
2912  {
2913  NS_LOG_INFO ("Timer is already in running state");
2914  }
2915  }
2916 
2917  if (withAck)
2918  {
2919  m_delAckEvent.Cancel ();
2920  m_delAckCount = 0;
2921  }
2922 
2923  // Sender should reduce the Congestion Window as a response to receiver's ECN Echo notification only once per window
2924  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_ECE_RCVD && m_ecnEchoSeq.Get() > m_ecnCWRSeq.Get () && !isRetransmission)
2925  {
2926  NS_LOG_INFO ("Backoff mechanism by reducing CWND by half because we've received ECN Echo");
2927  m_congestionControl->ReduceCwnd (m_tcb);
2928  m_tcb->m_ssThresh = m_tcb->m_cWnd;
2929  m_tcb->m_cWndInfl = m_tcb->m_cWnd;
2930  flags |= TcpHeader::CWR;
2931  m_ecnCWRSeq = seq;
2932  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_CWR_SENT");
2933  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_CWR_SENT;
2934  NS_LOG_INFO ("CWR flags set");
2935  }
2936 
2937  AddSocketTags (p);
2938 
2939  if (m_closeOnEmpty && (remainingData == 0))
2940  {
2941  flags |= TcpHeader::FIN;
2942  if (m_state == ESTABLISHED)
2943  { // On active close: I am the first one to send FIN
2944  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("ESTABLISHED -> FIN_WAIT_1");
2945  m_state = FIN_WAIT_1;
2946  }
2947  else if (m_state == CLOSE_WAIT)
2948  { // On passive close: Peer sent me FIN already
2949  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("CLOSE_WAIT -> LAST_ACK");
2950  m_state = LAST_ACK;
2951  }
2952  }
2953  TcpHeader header;
2954  header.SetFlags (flags);
2955  header.SetSequenceNumber (seq);
2956  header.SetAckNumber (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
2957  if (m_endPoint)
2958  {
2959  header.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint->GetLocalPort ());
2960  header.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint->GetPeerPort ());
2961  }
2962  else
2963  {
2964  header.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint6->GetLocalPort ());
2965  header.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint6->GetPeerPort ());
2966  }
2967  header.SetWindowSize (AdvertisedWindowSize ());
2968  AddOptions (header);
2969 
2970  if (m_retxEvent.IsExpired ())
2971  {
2972  // Schedules retransmit timeout. m_rto should be already doubled.
2973 
2974  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " SendDataPacket Schedule ReTxTimeout at time " <<
2975  Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds () << " to expire at time " <<
2976  (Simulator::Now () + m_rto.Get ()).GetSeconds () );
2977  m_retxEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_rto, &TcpSocketBase::ReTxTimeout, this);
2978  }
2979 
2980  m_txTrace (p, header, this);
2981 
2982  if (m_endPoint)
2983  {
2984  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, header, m_endPoint->GetLocalAddress (),
2985  m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
2986  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Send segment of size " << sz << " with remaining data " <<
2987  remainingData << " via TcpL4Protocol to " << m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress () <<
2988  ". Header " << header);
2989  }
2990  else
2991  {
2992  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, header, m_endPoint6->GetLocalAddress (),
2993  m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
2994  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Send segment of size " << sz << " with remaining data " <<
2995  remainingData << " via TcpL4Protocol to " << m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress () <<
2996  ". Header " << header);
2997  }
2998 
2999  UpdateRttHistory (seq, sz, isRetransmission);
3000 
3001  // Update bytes sent during recovery phase
3002  if(m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY)
3003  {
3004  m_recoveryOps->UpdateBytesSent (sz);
3005  }
3006 
3007  // Notify the application of the data being sent unless this is a retransmit
3008  if (!isRetransmission)
3009  {
3010  Simulator::ScheduleNow (&TcpSocketBase::NotifyDataSent, this,
3011  (seq + sz - m_tcb->m_highTxMark.Get ()));
3012  }
3013  // Update highTxMark
3014  m_tcb->m_highTxMark = std::max (seq + sz, m_tcb->m_highTxMark.Get ());
3015  return sz;
3016 }
3017 
3018 void
3019 TcpSocketBase::UpdateRttHistory (const SequenceNumber32 &seq, uint32_t sz,
3020  bool isRetransmission)
3021 {
3022  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
3023 
3024  // update the history of sequence numbers used to calculate the RTT
3025  if (isRetransmission == false)
3026  { // This is the next expected one, just log at end
3027  m_history.push_back (RttHistory (seq, sz, Simulator::Now ()));
3028  }
3029  else
3030  { // This is a retransmit, find in list and mark as re-tx
3031  for (std::deque<RttHistory>::iterator i = m_history.begin (); i != m_history.end (); ++i)
3032  {
3033  if ((seq >= i->seq) && (seq < (i->seq + SequenceNumber32 (i->count))))
3034  { // Found it
3035  i->retx = true;
3036  i->count = ((seq + SequenceNumber32 (sz)) - i->seq); // And update count in hist
3037  break;
3038  }
3039  }
3040  }
3041 }
3042 
3043 // Note that this function did not implement the PSH flag
3044 uint32_t
3045 TcpSocketBase::SendPendingData (bool withAck)
3046 {
3047  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << withAck);
3048  if (m_txBuffer->Size () == 0)
3049  {
3050  return false; // Nothing to send
3051  }
3052  if (m_endPoint == nullptr && m_endPoint6 == nullptr)
3053  {
3054  NS_LOG_INFO ("TcpSocketBase::SendPendingData: No endpoint; m_shutdownSend=" << m_shutdownSend);
3055  return false; // Is this the right way to handle this condition?
3056  }
3057 
3058  uint32_t nPacketsSent = 0;
3059  uint32_t availableWindow = AvailableWindow ();
3060 
3061  // RFC 6675, Section (C)
3062  // If cwnd - pipe >= 1 SMSS, the sender SHOULD transmit one or more
3063  // segments as follows:
3064  // (NOTE: We check > 0, and do the checks for segmentSize in the following
3065  // else branch to control silly window syndrome and Nagle)
3066  while (availableWindow > 0)
3067  {
3068  if (m_tcb->m_pacing)
3069  {
3070  NS_LOG_INFO ("Pacing is enabled");
3071  if (m_pacingTimer.IsRunning ())
3072  {
3073  NS_LOG_INFO ("Skipping Packet due to pacing" << m_pacingTimer.GetDelayLeft ());
3074  break;
3075  }
3076  NS_LOG_INFO ("Timer is not running");
3077  }
3078 
3079  if (m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_OPEN
3080  && m_state == TcpSocket::FIN_WAIT_1)
3081  {
3082  NS_LOG_INFO ("FIN_WAIT and OPEN state; no data to transmit");
3083  break;
3084  }
3085  // (C.1) The scoreboard MUST be queried via NextSeg () for the
3086  // sequence number range of the next segment to transmit (if
3087  // any), and the given segment sent. If NextSeg () returns
3088  // failure (no data to send), return without sending anything
3089  // (i.e., terminate steps C.1 -- C.5).
3090  SequenceNumber32 next;
3091  bool enableRule3 = m_sackEnabled && m_tcb->m_congState == TcpSocketState::CA_RECOVERY;
3092  if (!m_txBuffer->NextSeg (&next, enableRule3))
3093  {
3094  NS_LOG_INFO ("no valid seq to transmit, or no data available");
3095  break;
3096  }
3097  else
3098  {
3099  // It's time to transmit, but before do silly window and Nagle's check
3100  uint32_t availableData = m_txBuffer->SizeFromSequence (next);
3101 
3102  // If there's less app data than the full window, ask the app for more
3103  // data before trying to send
3104  if (availableData < availableWindow)
3105  {
3106  NotifySend (GetTxAvailable ());
3107  }
3108 
3109  // Stop sending if we need to wait for a larger Tx window (prevent silly window syndrome)
3110  // but continue if we don't have data
3111  if (availableWindow < m_tcb->m_segmentSize && availableData > availableWindow)
3112  {
3113  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Preventing Silly Window Syndrome. Wait to send.");
3114  break; // No more
3115  }
3116  // Nagle's algorithm (RFC896): Hold off sending if there is unacked data
3117  // in the buffer and the amount of data to send is less than one segment
3118  if (!m_noDelay && UnAckDataCount () > 0 && availableData < m_tcb->m_segmentSize)
3119  {
3120  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Invoking Nagle's algorithm for seq " << next <<
3121  ", SFS: " << m_txBuffer->SizeFromSequence (next) <<
3122  ". Wait to send.");
3123  break;
3124  }
3125 
3126  uint32_t s = std::min (availableWindow, m_tcb->m_segmentSize);
3127 
3128  // (C.2) If any of the data octets sent in (C.1) are below HighData,
3129  // HighRxt MUST be set to the highest sequence number of the
3130  // retransmitted segment unless NextSeg () rule (4) was
3131  // invoked for this retransmission.
3132  // (C.3) If any of the data octets sent in (C.1) are above HighData,
3133  // HighData must be updated to reflect the transmission of
3134  // previously unsent data.
3135  //
3136  // These steps are done in m_txBuffer with the tags.
3137  if (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence != next)
3138  {
3139  m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence = next;
3140  }
3141  if (m_tcb->m_bytesInFlight.Get () == 0)
3142  {
3143  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_TX_START);
3144  }
3145  uint32_t sz = SendDataPacket (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence, s, withAck);
3146  m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence += sz;
3147 
3148  NS_LOG_LOGIC (" rxwin " << m_rWnd <<
3149  " segsize " << m_tcb->m_segmentSize <<
3150  " highestRxAck " << m_txBuffer->HeadSequence () <<
3151  " pd->Size " << m_txBuffer->Size () <<
3152  " pd->SFS " << m_txBuffer->SizeFromSequence (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence));
3153 
3154  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("cWnd: " << m_tcb->m_cWnd <<
3155  " total unAck: " << UnAckDataCount () <<
3156  " sent seq " << m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence <<
3157  " size " << sz);
3158  ++nPacketsSent;
3159  if (m_tcb->m_pacing)
3160  {
3161  NS_LOG_INFO ("Pacing is enabled");
3162  if (m_pacingTimer.IsExpired ())
3163  {
3164  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Current Pacing Rate " << m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate);
3165  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Timer is in expired state, activate it " << m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate.CalculateBytesTxTime (sz));
3166  m_pacingTimer.Schedule (m_tcb->m_currentPacingRate.CalculateBytesTxTime (sz));
3167  break;
3168  }
3169  }
3170  }
3171 
3172  // (C.4) The estimate of the amount of data outstanding in the
3173  // network must be updated by incrementing pipe by the number
3174  // of octets transmitted in (C.1).
3175  //
3176  // Done in BytesInFlight, inside AvailableWindow.
3177  availableWindow = AvailableWindow ();
3178 
3179  // (C.5) If cwnd - pipe >= 1 SMSS, return to (C.1)
3180  // loop again!
3181  }
3182 
3183  if (nPacketsSent > 0)
3184  {
3185  if (!m_sackEnabled)
3186  {
3187  if (!m_limitedTx)
3188  {
3189  // We can't transmit in CA_DISORDER without limitedTx active
3190  NS_ASSERT (m_tcb->m_congState != TcpSocketState::CA_DISORDER);
3191  }
3192  }
3193 
3194  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SendPendingData sent " << nPacketsSent << " segments");
3195  }
3196  else
3197  {
3198  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("SendPendingData no segments sent");
3199  }
3200  return nPacketsSent;
3201 }
3202 
3203 uint32_t
3204 TcpSocketBase::UnAckDataCount () const
3205 {
3206  return m_tcb->m_highTxMark - m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ();
3207 }

3210 TcpSocketBase::BytesInFlight () const
3211 {
3212  uint32_t bytesInFlight = m_txBuffer->BytesInFlight ();
3213  // Ugly, but we are not modifying the state; m_bytesInFlight is used
3214  // only for tracing purpose.
3215  m_tcb->m_bytesInFlight = bytesInFlight;
3216 
3217  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Returning calculated bytesInFlight: " << bytesInFlight);
3218  return bytesInFlight;

3221 uint32_t
3222 TcpSocketBase::Window (void) const
3223 {
3224  return std::min (m_rWnd.Get (), m_tcb->m_cWnd.Get ());

3227 uint32_t
3228 TcpSocketBase::AvailableWindow () const
3229 {
3230  uint32_t win = Window (); // Number of bytes allowed to be outstanding
3231  uint32_t inflight = BytesInFlight (); // Number of outstanding bytes
3232  return (inflight > win) ? 0 : win - inflight;
3233 }
