3235 uint16_t
3236 TcpSocketBase::AdvertisedWindowSize (bool scale) const
3237 {
3238  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << scale);
3239  uint32_t w;
3240 
3241  // We don't want to advertise 0 after a FIN is received. So, we just use
3242  // the previous value of the advWnd.
3243  if (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->GotFin ())
3244  {
3245  w = m_advWnd;
3246  }
3247  else
3248  {
3249  NS_ASSERT_MSG (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxRxSequence () - m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence () >= 0,
3250  "Unexpected sequence number values");
3251  w = static_cast<uint32_t> (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxRxSequence () - m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
3252  }
3253 
3254  // Ugly, but we are not modifying the state, that variable
3255  // is used only for tracing purpose.
3256  if (w != m_advWnd)
3257  {
3258  const_cast<TcpSocketBase*> (this)->m_advWnd = w;
3259  }
3260  if (scale)
3261  {
3262  w >>= m_rcvWindShift;
3263  }
3264  if (w > m_maxWinSize)
3265  {
3266  w = m_maxWinSize;
3267  NS_LOG_WARN ("Adv window size truncated to " << m_maxWinSize << "; possibly to avoid overflow of the 16-bit integer");
3268  }
3269  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Returning AdvertisedWindowSize of " << static_cast<uint16_t> (w));
3270  return static_cast<uint16_t> (w);
3271 }
3272 
3273 // Receipt of new packet, put into Rx buffer
3274 void
3275 TcpSocketBase::ReceivedData (Ptr<Packet> p, const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
3276 {
3277  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << tcpHeader);
3278  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Data segment, seq=" << tcpHeader.GetSequenceNumber () <<
3279  " pkt size=" << p->GetSize () );
3280 
3281  // Put into Rx buffer
3282  SequenceNumber32 expectedSeq = m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ();
3283  if (!m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Add (p, tcpHeader))
3284  { // Insert failed: No data or RX buffer full
3285  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
3286  {
3287  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
3288  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_SENDING_ECE");
3289  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
3290  }
3291  else
3292  {
3293  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
3294  }
3295  return;
3296  }
3297  // Notify app to receive if necessary
3298  if (expectedSeq < m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ())
3299  { // NextRxSeq advanced, we have something to send to the app
3300  if (!m_shutdownRecv)
3301  {
3302  NotifyDataRecv ();
3303  }
3304  // Handle exceptions
3305  if (m_closeNotified)
3306  {
3307  NS_LOG_WARN ("Why TCP " << this << " got data after close notification?");
3308  }
3309  // If we received FIN before and now completed all "holes" in rx buffer,
3310  // invoke peer close procedure
3311  if (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Finished () && (tcpHeader.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::FIN) == 0)
3312  {
3313  DoPeerClose ();
3314  return;
3315  }
3316  }
3317  // Now send a new ACK packet acknowledging all received and delivered data
3318  if (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Size () > m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->Available () || m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence () > expectedSeq + p->GetSize ())
3319  { // A gap exists in the buffer, or we filled a gap: Always ACK
3320  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_NON_DELAYED_ACK);
3321  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
3322  {
3323  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
3324  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_SENDING_ECE");
3325  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
3326  }
3327  else
3328  {
3329  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
3330  }
3331  }
3332  else
3333  { // In-sequence packet: ACK if delayed ack count allows
3334  if (++m_delAckCount >= m_delAckMaxCount)
3335  {
3336  m_delAckEvent.Cancel ();
3337  m_delAckCount = 0;
3338  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_NON_DELAYED_ACK);
3339  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
3340  {
3341  NS_LOG_DEBUG("Congestion algo " << m_congestionControl->GetName ());
3342  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
3343  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_SENDING_ECE");
3344  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
3345  }
3346  else
3347  {
3348  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
3349  }
3350  }
3351  else if (!m_delAckEvent.IsExpired ())
3352  {
3353  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_DELAYED_ACK);
3354  }
3355  else if (m_delAckEvent.IsExpired ())
3356  {
3357  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_DELAYED_ACK);
3358  m_delAckEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_delAckTimeout,
3359  &TcpSocketBase::DelAckTimeout, this);
3360  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " scheduled delayed ACK at " <<
3361  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_delAckEvent)).GetSeconds ());
3362  }
3363  }
3364 }
3365 
3373 void
3374 TcpSocketBase::EstimateRtt (const TcpHeader& tcpHeader)
3375 {
3376  SequenceNumber32 ackSeq = tcpHeader.GetAckNumber ();
3377  Time m = Time (0.0);
3378 
3379  // An ack has been received, calculate rtt and log this measurement
3380  // Note we use a linear search (O(n)) for this since for the common
3381  // case the ack'ed packet will be at the head of the list
3382  if (!m_history.empty ())
3383  {
3384  RttHistory& h = m_history.front ();
3385  if (!h.retx && ackSeq >= (h.seq + SequenceNumber32 (h.count)))
3386  { // Ok to use this sample
3387  if (m_timestampEnabled && tcpHeader.HasOption (TcpOption::TS))
3388  {
3389  Ptr<const TcpOptionTS> ts;
3390  ts = DynamicCast<const TcpOptionTS> (tcpHeader.GetOption (TcpOption::TS));
3391  m = TcpOptionTS::ElapsedTimeFromTsValue (ts->GetEcho ());
3392  }
3393  else
3394  {
3395  m = Simulator::Now () - h.time; // Elapsed time
3396  }
3397  }
3398  }
3399 
3400  // Now delete all ack history with seq <= ack
3401  while (!m_history.empty ())
3402  {
3403  RttHistory& h = m_history.front ();
3404  if ((h.seq + SequenceNumber32 (h.count)) > ackSeq)
3405  {
3406  break; // Done removing
3407  }
3408  m_history.pop_front (); // Remove
3409  }
3410 
3411  if (!m.IsZero ())
3412  {
3413  m_rtt->Measurement (m); // Log the measurement
3414  // RFC 6298, clause 2.4
3415  m_rto = Max (m_rtt->GetEstimate () + Max (m_clockGranularity, m_rtt->GetVariation () * 4), m_minRto);
3416  m_tcb->m_lastRtt = m_rtt->GetEstimate ();
3417  m_tcb->m_minRtt = std::min (m_tcb->m_lastRtt.Get (), m_tcb->m_minRtt);
3418  NS_LOG_INFO (this << m_tcb->m_lastRtt << m_tcb->m_minRtt);
3419  }
3420 }
3421 
3422 // Called by the ReceivedAck() when new ACK received and by ProcessSynRcvd()
3423 // when the three-way handshake completed. This cancels retransmission timer
3424 // and advances Tx window
3425 void
3426 TcpSocketBase::NewAck (SequenceNumber32 const& ack, bool resetRTO)
3427 {
3428  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << ack);
3429 
3430  // Reset the data retransmission count. We got a new ACK!
3431  m_dataRetrCount = m_dataRetries;
3432 
3433  if (m_state != SYN_RCVD && resetRTO)
3434  { // Set RTO unless the ACK is received in SYN_RCVD state
3435  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Cancelled ReTxTimeout event which was set to expire at " <<
3436  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_retxEvent)).GetSeconds ());
3437  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
3438  // On receiving a "New" ack we restart retransmission timer .. RFC 6298
3439  // RFC 6298, clause 2.4
3440  m_rto = Max (m_rtt->GetEstimate () + Max (m_clockGranularity, m_rtt->GetVariation () * 4), m_minRto);
3441 
3442  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Schedule ReTxTimeout at time " <<
3443  Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds () << " to expire at time " <<
3444  (Simulator::Now () + m_rto.Get ()).GetSeconds ());
3445  m_retxEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_rto, &TcpSocketBase::ReTxTimeout, this);
3446  }
3447 
3448  // Note the highest ACK and tell app to send more
3449  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("TCP " << this << " NewAck " << ack <<
3450  " numberAck " << (ack - m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ())); // Number bytes ack'ed
3451 
3452  if (GetTxAvailable () > 0)
3453  {
3454  NotifySend (GetTxAvailable ());
3455  }
3456  if (ack > m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence)
3457  {
3458  m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence = ack; // If advanced
3459  }
3460  if (m_txBuffer->Size () == 0 && m_state != FIN_WAIT_1 && m_state != CLOSING)
3461  { // No retransmit timer if no data to retransmit
3462  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " Cancelled ReTxTimeout event which was set to expire at " <<
3463  (Simulator::Now () + Simulator::GetDelayLeft (m_retxEvent)).GetSeconds ());
3464  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
3465  }
3466 }
3467 
3468 // Retransmit timeout
3469 void
3470 TcpSocketBase::ReTxTimeout ()
3471 {
3472  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
3473  NS_LOG_LOGIC (this << " ReTxTimeout Expired at time " << Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds ());
3474  // If erroneous timeout in closed/timed-wait state, just return
3475  if (m_state == CLOSED || m_state == TIME_WAIT)
3476  {
3477  return;
3478  }
3479 
3480  if (m_state == SYN_SENT)
3481  {
3482  if (m_synCount > 0)
3483  {
3484  if (m_tcb->m_useEcn != TcpSocketState::Off)
3485  {
3486  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN | TcpHeader::ECE | TcpHeader::CWR);
3487  }
3488  else
3489  {
3490  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::SYN);
3491  }
3492  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED;
3493  }
3494  else
3495  {
3496  NotifyConnectionFailed ();
3497  }
3498  return;
3499  }
3500 
3501  // Retransmit non-data packet: Only if in FIN_WAIT_1 or CLOSING state
3502  if (m_txBuffer->Size () == 0)
3503  {
3504  if (m_state == FIN_WAIT_1 || m_state == CLOSING)
3505  { // Must have lost FIN, re-send
3506  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::FIN);
3507  }
3508  return;
3509  }
3510 
3511  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Checking if Connection is Established");
3512  // If all data are received (non-closing socket and nothing to send), just return
3513  if (m_state <= ESTABLISHED && m_txBuffer->HeadSequence () >= m_tcb->m_highTxMark && m_txBuffer->Size () == 0)
3514  {
3515  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("Already Sent full data" << m_txBuffer->HeadSequence () << " " << m_tcb->m_highTxMark);
3516  return;
3517  }
3518 
3519  if (m_dataRetrCount == 0)
3520  {
3521  NS_LOG_INFO ("No more data retries available. Dropping connection");
3522  NotifyErrorClose ();
3523  DeallocateEndPoint ();
3524  return;
3525  }
3526  else
3527  {
3528  --m_dataRetrCount;
3529  }
3530 
3531  uint32_t inFlightBeforeRto = BytesInFlight ();
3532  bool resetSack = !m_sackEnabled; // Reset SACK information if SACK is not enabled.
3533  // The information in the TcpTxBuffer is guessed, in this case.
3534 
3535  // Reset dupAckCount
3536  m_dupAckCount = 0;
3537  if (!m_sackEnabled)
3538  {
3539  m_txBuffer->ResetRenoSack ();
3540  }
3541 
3542  // From RFC 6675, Section 5.1
3543  // [RFC2018] suggests that a TCP sender SHOULD expunge the SACK
3544  // information gathered from a receiver upon a retransmission timeout
3545  // (RTO) "since the timeout might indicate that the data receiver has
3546  // reneged." Additionally, a TCP sender MUST "ignore prior SACK
3547  // information in determining which data to retransmit."
3548  // It has been suggested that, as long as robust tests for
3549  // reneging are present, an implementation can retain and use SACK
3550  // information across a timeout event [Errata1610].
3551  // The head of the sent list will not be marked as sacked, therefore
3552  // will be retransmitted, if the receiver renegotiate the SACK blocks
3553  // that we received.
3554  m_txBuffer->SetSentListLost (resetSack);
3555 
3556  // From RFC 6675, Section 5.1
3557  // If an RTO occurs during loss recovery as specified in this document,
3558  // RecoveryPoint MUST be set to HighData. Further, the new value of
3559  // RecoveryPoint MUST be preserved and the loss recovery algorithm
3560  // outlined in this document MUST be terminated.
3561  m_recover = m_tcb->m_highTxMark;
3562 
3563  // RFC 6298, clause 2.5, double the timer
3564  Time doubledRto = m_rto + m_rto;
3565  m_rto = Min (doubledRto, Time::FromDouble (60, Time::S));
3566 
3567  // Empty RTT history
3568  m_history.clear ();
3569 
3570  // Please don't reset highTxMark, it is used for retransmission detection
3571 
3572  // When a TCP sender detects segment loss using the retransmission timer
3573  // and the given segment has not yet been resent by way of the
3574  // retransmission timer, decrease ssThresh
3575  if (m_tcb->m_congState != TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS || !m_txBuffer->IsHeadRetransmitted ())
3576  {
3577  m_tcb->m_ssThresh = m_congestionControl->GetSsThresh (m_tcb, inFlightBeforeRto);
3578  }
3579 
3580  // Cwnd set to 1 MSS
3581  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_LOSS);
3582  m_congestionControl->CongestionStateSet (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS);
3583  m_tcb->m_congState = TcpSocketState::CA_LOSS;
3584  m_tcb->m_cWnd = m_tcb->m_segmentSize;
3585  m_tcb->m_cWndInfl = m_tcb->m_cWnd;
3586 
3587  m_pacingTimer.Cancel ();
3588 
3589  NS_LOG_DEBUG ("RTO. Reset cwnd to " << m_tcb->m_cWnd << ", ssthresh to " <<
3590  m_tcb->m_ssThresh << ", restart from seqnum " <<
3591  m_txBuffer->HeadSequence () << " doubled rto to " <<
3592  m_rto.Get ().GetSeconds () << " s");
3593 
3594  NS_ASSERT_MSG (BytesInFlight () == 0, "There are some bytes in flight after an RTO: " <<
3595  BytesInFlight ());
3596 
3597  SendPendingData (m_connected);
3598 
3599  NS_ASSERT_MSG (BytesInFlight () <= m_tcb->m_segmentSize,
3600  "In flight (" << BytesInFlight () <<
3601  ") there is more than one segment (" << m_tcb->m_segmentSize << ")");
3602 }
3603 
3604 void
3605 TcpSocketBase::DelAckTimeout (void)
3606 {
3607  m_delAckCount = 0;
3608  m_congestionControl->CwndEvent (m_tcb, TcpSocketState::CA_EVENT_DELAYED_ACK);
3609  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
3610  {
3611  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
3612  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
3613  }
3614  else
3615  {
3616  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
3617  }
3618 }
3619 
3620 void
3621 TcpSocketBase::LastAckTimeout (void)
3622 {
3623  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
3624 
3625  m_lastAckEvent.Cancel ();
3626  if (m_state == LAST_ACK)
3627  {
3628  CloseAndNotify ();
3629  }
3630  if (!m_closeNotified)
3631  {
3632  m_closeNotified = true;
3633  }
3634 }
3635 
3636 // Send 1-byte data to probe for the window size at the receiver when
3637 // the local knowledge tells that the receiver has zero window size
3638 // C.f.: RFC793 p.42, RFC1112 sec.4.2.2.17
3639 void
3640 TcpSocketBase::PersistTimeout ()
3641 {
3642  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("PersistTimeout expired at " << Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds ());
3643  m_persistTimeout = std::min (Seconds (60), Time (2 * m_persistTimeout)); // max persist timeout = 60s
3644  Ptr<Packet> p = m_txBuffer->CopyFromSequence (1, m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence)->GetPacketCopy ();
3645  m_txBuffer->ResetLastSegmentSent ();
3646  TcpHeader tcpHeader;
3647  tcpHeader.SetSequenceNumber (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence);
3648  tcpHeader.SetAckNumber (m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence ());
3649  tcpHeader.SetWindowSize (AdvertisedWindowSize ());
3650  if (m_endPoint != nullptr)
3651  {
3652  tcpHeader.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint->GetLocalPort ());
3653  tcpHeader.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint->GetPeerPort ());
3654  }
3655  else
3656  {
3657  tcpHeader.SetSourcePort (m_endPoint6->GetLocalPort ());
3658  tcpHeader.SetDestinationPort (m_endPoint6->GetPeerPort ());
3659  }
3660  AddOptions (tcpHeader);
3661  //Send a packet tag for setting ECT bits in IP header
3662  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState != TcpSocketState::ECN_DISABLED)
3663  {
3664  SocketIpTosTag ipTosTag;
3665  ipTosTag.SetTos (MarkEcnCodePoint (0, m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
3666  p->AddPacketTag (ipTosTag);
3667 
3668  SocketIpv6TclassTag ipTclassTag;
3669  ipTclassTag.SetTclass (MarkEcnCodePoint (0, m_tcb->m_ectCodePoint));
3670  p->AddPacketTag (ipTclassTag);
3671  }
3672  m_txTrace (p, tcpHeader, this);
3673 
3674  if (m_endPoint != nullptr)
3675  {
3676  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, tcpHeader, m_endPoint->GetLocalAddress (),
3677  m_endPoint->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
3678  }
3679  else
3680  {
3681  m_tcp->SendPacket (p, tcpHeader, m_endPoint6->GetLocalAddress (),
3682  m_endPoint6->GetPeerAddress (), m_boundnetdevice);
3683  }
3684 
3685  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("Schedule persist timeout at time "
3686  << Simulator::Now ().GetSeconds () << " to expire at time "
3687  << (Simulator::Now () + m_persistTimeout).GetSeconds ());
3688  m_persistEvent = Simulator::Schedule (m_persistTimeout, &TcpSocketBase::PersistTimeout, this);
3689 }
3690 
3691 void
3692 TcpSocketBase::DoRetransmit ()
3693 {
3694  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
3695  bool res;
3696  SequenceNumber32 seq;
3697 
3698  // Find the first segment marked as lost and not retransmitted. With Reno,
3699  // that should be the head
3700  res = m_txBuffer->NextSeg (&seq, false);
3701  if (!res)
3702  {
3703  // We have already retransmitted the head. However, we still received
3704  // three dupacks, or the RTO expired, but no data to transmit.
3705  // Therefore, re-send again the head.
3706  seq = m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ();
3707  }
3708  NS_ASSERT (m_sackEnabled || seq == m_txBuffer->HeadSequence ());
3709 
3710  NS_LOG_INFO ("Retransmitting " << seq);
3711  // Update the trace and retransmit the segment
3712  m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence = seq;
3713  uint32_t sz = SendDataPacket (m_tcb->m_nextTxSequence, m_tcb->m_segmentSize, true);
3714 
3715  NS_ASSERT (sz > 0);
3716 }
3717 
3718 void
3719 TcpSocketBase::CancelAllTimers ()
3720 {
3721  m_retxEvent.Cancel ();
3722  m_persistEvent.Cancel ();
3723  m_delAckEvent.Cancel ();
3724  m_lastAckEvent.Cancel ();
3725  m_timewaitEvent.Cancel ();
3726  m_sendPendingDataEvent.Cancel ();
3727  m_pacingTimer.Cancel ();
3728 }
3729 
3730 /* Move TCP to Time_Wait state and schedule a transition to Closed state */
3731 void
3732 TcpSocketBase::TimeWait ()
3733 {
3734  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpStateName[m_state] << " -> TIME_WAIT");
3735  m_state = TIME_WAIT;
3736  CancelAllTimers ();
3737  if (!m_closeNotified)
3738  {
3739  // Technically the connection is not fully closed, but we notify now
3740  // because an implementation (real socket) would behave as if closed.
3741  // Notify normal close when entering TIME_WAIT or leaving LAST_ACK.
3742  NotifyNormalClose ();
3743  m_closeNotified = true;
3744  }
3745  // Move from TIME_WAIT to CLOSED after 2*MSL. Max segment lifetime is 2 min
3746  // according to RFC793, p.28
3747  m_timewaitEvent = Simulator::Schedule (Seconds (2 * m_msl),
3748  &TcpSocketBase::CloseAndNotify, this);
3749 }

3767 TcpSocketBase::SetRcvBufSize (uint32_t size)
3768 {
3769  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << size);
3770  uint32_t oldSize = GetRcvBufSize ();
3771 
3772  m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->SetMaxBufferSize (size);
3773 
3774  /* The size has (manually) increased. Actively inform the other end to prevent
3775  * stale zero-window states.
3776  */
3777  if (oldSize < size && m_connected)
3778  {
3779  if (m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_CE_RCVD || m_tcb->m_ecnState == TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE)
3780  {
3781  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK | TcpHeader::ECE);
3782  NS_LOG_DEBUG (TcpSocketState::EcnStateName[m_tcb->m_ecnState] << " -> ECN_SENDING_ECE");
3783  m_tcb->m_ecnState = TcpSocketState::ECN_SENDING_ECE;
3784  }
3785  else
3786  {
3787  SendEmptyPacket (TcpHeader::ACK);
3788  }
3789  }
3790 }

3930 void
3931 TcpSocketBase::ProcessOptionWScale (const Ptr<const TcpOption> option)
3932 {
3933  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << option);
3934 
3935  Ptr<const TcpOptionWinScale> ws = DynamicCast<const TcpOptionWinScale> (option);
3936 
3937  // In naming, we do the contrary of RFC 1323. The received scaling factor
3938  // is Rcv.Wind.Scale (and not Snd.Wind.Scale)
3939  m_sndWindShift = ws->GetScale ();
3940 
3941  if (m_sndWindShift > 14)
3942  {
3943  NS_LOG_WARN ("Possible error; m_sndWindShift exceeds 14: " << m_sndWindShift);
3944  m_sndWindShift = 14;
3945  }
3946 
3947  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Received a scale factor of " <<
3948  static_cast<int> (m_sndWindShift));
3949 }
3950 
3951 uint8_t
3952 TcpSocketBase::CalculateWScale () const
3953 {
3954  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this);
3955  uint32_t maxSpace = m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxBufferSize ();
3956  uint8_t scale = 0;
3957 
3958  while (maxSpace > m_maxWinSize)
3959  {
3960  maxSpace = maxSpace >> 1;
3961  ++scale;
3962  }
3963 
3964  if (scale > 14)
3965  {
3966  NS_LOG_WARN ("Possible error; scale exceeds 14: " << scale);
3967  scale = 14;
3968  }
3969 
3970  NS_LOG_INFO ("Node " << m_node->GetId () << " calculated wscale factor of " <<
3971  static_cast<int> (scale) << " for buffer size " << m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->MaxBufferSize ());
3972  return scale;
3973 }

3975 void
3976 TcpSocketBase::AddOptionWScale (TcpHeader &header)
3977 {
3978  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << header);
3979  NS_ASSERT (header.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::SYN);
3980 
3981  Ptr<TcpOptionWinScale> option = CreateObject<TcpOptionWinScale> ();
3982 
3983  // In naming, we do the contrary of RFC 1323. The sended scaling factor
3984  // is Snd.Wind.Scale (and not Rcv.Wind.Scale)
3985 
3986  m_rcvWindShift = CalculateWScale ();
3987  option->SetScale (m_rcvWindShift);
3988 
3989  header.AppendOption (option);
3990 
3991  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Send a scaling factor of " <<
3992  static_cast<int> (m_rcvWindShift));
3993 }

4004 void
4005 TcpSocketBase::ProcessOptionSackPermitted (const Ptr<const TcpOption> option)
4006 {
4007  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << option);
4008 
4009  Ptr<const TcpOptionSackPermitted> s = DynamicCast<const TcpOptionSackPermitted> (option);
4010 
4011  NS_ASSERT (m_sackEnabled == true);
4012  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Received a SACK_PERMITTED option " << s);
4013 }
4014 
4015 void
4016 TcpSocketBase::AddOptionSackPermitted (TcpHeader &header)
4017 {
4018  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << header);
4019  NS_ASSERT (header.GetFlags () & TcpHeader::SYN);
4020 
4021  Ptr<TcpOptionSackPermitted> option = CreateObject<TcpOptionSackPermitted> ();
4022  header.AppendOption (option);
4023  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Add option SACK-PERMITTED");
4024 }
4025 
4026 void
4027 TcpSocketBase::AddOptionSack (TcpHeader& header)
4028 {
4029  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << header);
4030 
4031  // Calculate the number of SACK blocks allowed in this packet
4032  uint8_t optionLenAvail = header.GetMaxOptionLength () - header.GetOptionLength ();
4033  uint8_t allowedSackBlocks = (optionLenAvail - 2) / 8;
4034 
4035  TcpOptionSack::SackList sackList = m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->GetSackList ();
4036  if (allowedSackBlocks == 0 || sackList.empty ())
4037  {
4038  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("No space available or sack list empty, not adding sack blocks");
4039  return;
4040  }
4041 
4042  // Append the allowed number of SACK blocks
4043  Ptr<TcpOptionSack> option = CreateObject<TcpOptionSack> ();
4044  TcpOptionSack::SackList::iterator i;
4045  for (i = sackList.begin (); allowedSackBlocks > 0 && i != sackList.end (); ++i)
4046  {
4047  option->AddSackBlock (*i);
4048  allowedSackBlocks--;
4049  }
4050 
4051  header.AppendOption (option);
4052  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Add option SACK " << *option);
4053 }
4054 
4055 void
4056 TcpSocketBase::ProcessOptionTimestamp (const Ptr<const TcpOption> option,
4057  const SequenceNumber32 &seq)
4058 {
4059  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << option);
4060 
4061  Ptr<const TcpOptionTS> ts = DynamicCast<const TcpOptionTS> (option);
4062 
4063  // This is valid only when no overflow occurs. It happens
4064  // when a connection last longer than 50 days.
4065  if (m_tcb->m_rcvTimestampValue > ts->GetTimestamp ())
4066  {
4067  // Do not save a smaller timestamp (probably there is reordering)
4068  return;
4069  }
4070 
4071  m_tcb->m_rcvTimestampValue = ts->GetTimestamp ();
4072  m_tcb->m_rcvTimestampEchoReply = ts->GetEcho ();
4073 
4074  if (seq == m_tcb->m_rxBuffer->NextRxSequence () && seq <= m_highTxAck)
4075  {
4076  m_timestampToEcho = ts->GetTimestamp ();
4077  }
4078 
4079  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Got timestamp=" <<
4080  m_timestampToEcho << " and Echo=" << ts->GetEcho ());
4081 }
4082 
4083 void
4084 TcpSocketBase::AddOptionTimestamp (TcpHeader& header)
4085 {
4086  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << header);
4087 
4088  Ptr<TcpOptionTS> option = CreateObject<TcpOptionTS> ();
4089 
4090  option->SetTimestamp (TcpOptionTS::NowToTsValue ());
4091  option->SetEcho (m_timestampToEcho);
4092 
4093  header.AppendOption (option);
4094  NS_LOG_INFO (m_node->GetId () << " Add option TS, ts=" <<
4095  option->GetTimestamp () << " echo=" << m_timestampToEcho);
4096 }
4097 
4098 void TcpSocketBase::UpdateWindowSize (const TcpHeader &header)
4099 {
4100  NS_LOG_FUNCTION (this << header);
4101  // If the connection is not established, the window size is always
4102  // updated
4103  uint32_t receivedWindow = header.GetWindowSize ();
4104  receivedWindow <<= m_sndWindShift;
4105  NS_LOG_INFO ("Received (scaled) window is " << receivedWindow << " bytes");
4106  if (m_state < ESTABLISHED)
4107  {
4108  m_rWnd = receivedWindow;
4109  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("State less than ESTABLISHED; updating rWnd to " << m_rWnd);
4110  return;
4111  }
4112 
4113  // Test for conditions that allow updating of the window
4114  // 1) segment contains new data (advancing the right edge of the receive
4115  // buffer),
4116  // 2) segment does not contain new data but the segment acks new data
4117  // (highest sequence number acked advances), or
4118  // 3) the advertised window is larger than the current send window
4119  bool update = false;
4120  if (header.GetAckNumber () == m_highRxAckMark && receivedWindow > m_rWnd)
4121  {
4122  // right edge of the send window is increased (window update)
4123  update = true;
4124  }
4125  if (header.GetAckNumber () > m_highRxAckMark)
4126  {
4127  m_highRxAckMark = header.GetAckNumber ();
4128  update = true;
4129  }
4130  if (header.GetSequenceNumber () > m_highRxMark)
4131  {
4132  m_highRxMark = header.GetSequenceNumber ();
4133  update = true;
4134  }
4135  if (update == true)
4136  {
4137  m_rWnd = receivedWindow;
4138  NS_LOG_LOGIC ("updating rWnd to " << m_rWnd);
4139  }
4140 }
